comment: I really wanted to like this game since I have been a fan since the N64 version but there are so many flaws I don't know how this happens to such a large name title from Nintendo. The biggest flaw is online which was a big selling point. It is AWFUL, Nintendo do still had not learned how to make a decent online game and is about 14 years behind everyone else, the bad coding mixed with horrible input lag makes the game sluggish. Why am I forced to pay for an online subscription when the game connects of a p2p  network and every match is filled with lag to the point where it is not even enjoyable. Not to mention when you set your settings for 1v1 preferred matches you never get what you want and are then put into FFA lagfests. You can go to the arena mode but all that is just a waiting in line simulator when you have more than  2 people in a room. Why can you not switch your characters after a match? There are so many things wrong with this game it makes me worried for Nintendo. There are many more problems that have not been noted.

If you've played Smash Bros. since you got the n64 version, this game shows just how much the game has evolved. I am no means a "pro" when it comes to playing Smash Bros. but this game is the best I have played since it's first iteration.Let this be a disclaimer for all the people who have never played a Smash Bros game before, this game is overwhelming and taking it all in is a task within itself. Look at it this way, you bought a Tesla on the sheer fact that it's an electric car, only to find it has so many features you have to read a manual, but when you finally grasp the aspects of the car the reward is tremendous! So my advise to you is to take in each feature, one by one, and indulge in each of it's aspects. What you will find is a deep and enriching gaming experience that captures what Nintendo is all about, and at the same time you will learn how to truly Smash... your opponent into oblivion.

Let me begin by saying Super Smash Bros. has always been a fighting game franchise I've held dear since my childhood. Each new entry seemed to completely raise the bar, thereby raising my expectations for what kind of surprises were in store for us. And as far as the character reveals go, Super Smash Bros. Ultimate boasted a good amount of surprises for the fans. Lots of heavily requested fighters such as King K. Rool, Ridley and Simon Belmont finally graced the roster. However, I just don't see how they can call this the "Ultimate" version of Smash when so much was taken out in exchange for a larger than normal stage and fighter number. So this brings me to the ultimate question (sorry for the overuse of the word "ultimate" btw). Was what we gained better than what we lost? That's a difficult question for me to answer. Instead, I'll just spill my thoughts. Let's continue with the review.Part 1: Presentation. The formula of Super Smash Bros has remained relatively the same since its debut in 1999. Its control scheme is pretty unique for a fighting game. But, it works excellently. There are no 15-button combos, but a series of standard, special, and aerial attacks that can be used in whichever sequence you see fit. The objective of the game is to rack up damage on your opponents by beating them to a pulp using your wide variety of moves, items, assists etc. and then launching them off the stage. I simply adore the chaotic gameplay of Smash bros. and so do millions of people, hence the large fanbase. However, there are some people in this world who have never played a Smash game before (shocking, right?). I just feel the game could do a better job in presenting itself to newcomers. The "how to play" video doesn't show up until after the game's opening. How will people know to wait after the logo comes on the screen? Other than that, the menu is very clean and straightforward this time around. It only takes 3 button presses to get into a match with you and your buds. I also want to take this time and applaud the beautiful design of the menus. There is a nice mix between simplistic graphics and in-game images. It honestly deserves an award. Not only that, its easier than ever to add up to 8 players to a match, set up custom match rules and edit controller configurations. So much care went into making the experience pleasurable.

The Smash Bros franchise games have always been high quality and they just keep getting better. Amazon delivered mine at 9:30am release day with me waiting around the door like a giddy teen girl for her date. I have been awaiting this game more than any other ever since buying a switch. I was hooked right from the opening cinematic which showcases what makes this series so magical to its fans. So many familiar faces from the past 4 decades of gaming as either playable fighters or cameo appearances. All the nostalgia from seeing so many old "friends" gives me the feels... As soon as my wife gets from from her appointment, she joins in. This is her first Smash game and she is seeing what all the hype is about. At 3pm when the 13yo son and 6yo daughter, they both join in. Hours go by with us unlocking new characters and taking turns trying everyone out. We are all jumping out of our chairs/sofa and screaming when someone defeats a challenger and unlocks them for play, clamoring to be the first one to try them out. This game is so much fun, a heartfelt thank you to everyone who had a hand in its creation. The stages are more amazing than ever. The amount of content is staggering,so many items and temporary allies/Pokemon! Whether you have friends or family to play this with, or you are playing solo you owe it to yourself to try this if you have a Switch or are considering getting one. 10/10

Setting up your own matches is classic smash bros fun. Everything else is complete garbage. The new "spirits" mode that you have to play to unlock charecters is a hideous waste of time, with special rules to ensure that the outcome is based solely on luck rather than skill. You can try your hardest and loose in seconds, or you can set the controller down, and win. No, tgat is not an exaggeration, I've actually done it. This translates to hours and hours of essentially rolling dice. Definitely not what I look for in a game.

To get started this review will be aimed towards veterans, I will not be explaining what SSB is or how to play it. I will only go over what is different this time around so hold on to your seat. First things first, Here’s a pro tip for any Meta Knight mains, I need you to scroll to the top of the page, close Amazon and go back to For Honor where you obviously main Orochi (pls give Like if you got the joke) but really though. The first thing you want to do is go right into spirits mode, because you only get 8 or so characters to start. Any character you unlock in spirits mode will automatically join you in regular smash, however any character you unlock by triggering the “A new challenger appears” fight, will not be added to spirts. The best way I can describe this mode is a mix between Pokemon and Mario party, you and your opponents can equip spirits (that have replaced trophies) that can give you boosts like, improved jumps, stronger attacks, fire resistance, etc. And the ultimate goal is to equip spirits that counter your opponent’s. Although once you have your favorites leveled up enough it’s possible to just tank your way throughout most of the battles. Except for a few annoying ones. And get comfortable because this mode took me 15 hours to complete with only a 80% completion rate. I suggest you tough it out because the final act really makes the grind worth it.The entire Game has received minor graphical upgrades, as for the fighters themselves, all have obtained animation tweaks that give them more personality overall, Mario has a cooler down smash, Zelda has a new costume and can now throw energy beams with his sword at full health (A little inside joke for the Nintendo vets) Every part of the game really makes it feel like they put they’re heart and soul into it. The amount of content packed in here is astounding. Even the settings/rules you’re allowed to play with can be overwhelming at times, but don’t worry, you can save and name your custom rules so you can get back into the action quicker. Also be sure to take advantage of the ability to pick 2 stages and morph between them. Home run contest and target practice are gone, Because they had to save space somehow. But Here’s the real tragedy. I think all of us veterans know that picking the right color makes us play better, and some alternative colors where cut. Are they really expecting us Mario mains to go online and fight those Malakas Meta Knight mains without his fire flower outfit?! (AC fans where you at?) in all seriousness though, this game is a love letter too all the Smash fans that have been with this franchise throughout the years. Do yourself a favor. Buy this game and good luck online.

Oh, boy, I would love to be mashing my joycons playing this game right now. But guess what? Looks like the package isn’t on track, and is now expected December 8-11. So much for pre-ordering.Update: So it came the next morning. It makes sense since it was just released today! Love it!

I just want to frontload my review with this: I'm over 40, a father, and have never played another Super Smash Bros. game.  I've played older fighting games, like Street Fighter and Mortal Kombat, and know the gist of how they work.  I've played and enjoyed Breath of the Wild, Super Mario Odyssey, and Super Mario Kart 8 on the Switch very much.The good:  The backgrounds on this game are extremely well-done.  They can been a little confusing at times, as they move and drop you into new settings during a match, but that is easy enough to avoid, if you wish.  Fun if you're solely into button-mashing, with no strategy involved.

I just got the game today in the mail today and I opened it and there was no game. The package it came in, with multiple items from Amazon as well, was not tampered with or looked like it was so it couldn’t have been a post office or delivery worker that took it. When I took the game out I noticed the plastic cover (which every game has), was tampered with but thought nothing of it, but once I opened it, there was nothing there. It looked like someone cut the side but again I thought nothing of it. I think someone ordered this game, cut the side and took the game out, then returned it and got the money back. I think whoever is in charge should check every returned game to make sure the game is ACTUALLY in there. Honestly this is such bs

Great game.  A lot of fun.  However, I do have some complaints. I am a noob and it took a lot of work, looking online, youtube videos, and going through the menus to try to figure out what the game was even about, how to win, etc.  It also does a pretty poor job of tutorials and the menus aren't very intuitive.  There are a lot of confusing mechanics and options in the menu and the translation to english in the tutorials seems like there is something lost in translation.Additionally, I got it for a party tonight, excited that there would be 74 fighters as advertised, but only 8 are available.  Fighters are randomly unlocked by playing the game for hours.  You might unlock 2 in 1 hour or play for 4 and unlock none.  Plus you have no control of who gets unlocked.  Excited to play as Snake or Bayonetta?  Good luck.  Literally.  Unlocking them is just random luck.  Kind of a shame for people that just want this as a party game and don't want to put in all the effort and time to unlock all the characters that were alluded to being available.  Still fun, once you put in the time, unlock the characters, and figure out how to play, I think it will be fantastic.
This game is absolutely crazy. Love the new animations and feel of the game. Even joker is going to be in it! What else can we ask for

The only place this game shines is as a couch game with friends.  There's a world of fun customization options for you and your friends to dive into.  Beyond that, the fun stops.  There are a number of World of Light fights that I'm pretty sure were never actually tested.  They're completely unfun, and you spend your time praying for good RNG or broken AI instead of actually fighting.  The online matchmaking is awful, and you're often put into rulesets you didn't ask for.  And the overall character balance leaves a bit to be desired.  Great that you included so many characters in the game, but you're essentially throwing all hopes of ever balancing it out the window.  Is that really worth the tradeoff?Sadly, this is a completely forgettable and passable SSB game.
My freind told me pokemon lets go pikachu/eevee will outsell super smash ultimate.... I told him he needs to go seek medical help asap.

Mario still hasn’t made an appearance in smash brothers. I mean come on microsoft, but everyone else is in the game, even the girls from dead or alive. my friends say its better with the GameCube cobtrollers but even that also sucks. I plug in the game cube and none of the three buttons work except for one and all that does is flip open the disk reader.and that’s why I’m rating just dance at a 3/5. technology works efficiently but it’s  too gimmicky and repetitive

As a person who has been riding the hype train for Smash Ultimate, I was NOT disappointed in the slightest when I began to play it. There is just so much content in this game that I can already see myself having 100+ hours in it. I'm making this review because there was some concerns that I read in some other reviews and I want to point out some things.There was a review that talked about how you start off with 8 characters and how it was not advertised above. Although I cannot confirm the second statement as I did not read it, starting with 8 characters is true. The truth is, this game's 72 characters are unlocked every 10 minutes which if you do the math means a seriously long time. How to fix this? Play a match with 20 minutes facing any CPU on any stage with a lot of room. Once done you should see a new challenger. Beat them and exit out the game. Re-enter in the game and play again only this time with one live and self destruct at the start of a match. You should get another challenger. Rinse and repeat until you get all the characters and if it doesnt pop up anymore, redo the first method and follow the same progress. I have used this method and unlocked 53 characters and I could have done more if my switch didnt die or I wanted to eat. (I searched and found that I only played this game for 6 hours in my profile).

Boy am I livid. I had been waiting patiently for my physical copy to arrive and was looking forward to playing it after work the day it arrived. I opened up my SEALED case and it was EMPTY. NO MANUAL NO CARTRIDGE!!! WTF how does this even happen.

This is the first time I’ve ever played any version of Super Smash bro's. It’s loud, it’s flashy, it has great music, but has no instructions $^!*@#^!! I spent the first 15 minutes just trying to open a battle, then got destroyed for the next 30 minutes while I helplessly mashed any key I could. One hour and 10+ Google searches later, I was just trying to figure out how to open training mode. Was there a training mode? Thankfully yes. There is a training mode hidden here in a place you wouldn't think to look.After another hour trying to figure out how to do moves (the game only gives you instructions 5 moves.) The rest you kind of have to figure out on your own. I still have no idea how the spirits are used (are they just aura buffs?) and how much each level improves my character? Where are the stats? Why are there 2 spirits? Are there other special moves not listed on those 5 moves? Where can I find them? I use game suggested spirits because there is no darn manual to explain! Why can my damage go above 100%? How do I do a “final smash?” What the heck is a “final smash?” Why does Kirby change after eating an opponent? How do I revert back? What is the buff he gets? It is incredibly frustrating for first time players. I played fighting all my life and this is the first I’ve had so much trouble with.
Pros:+ Large roster of 75 fighters at launch.
(Update after Terry had just released, since having the game day 1)Online is terrible, single player is terrible. Outside of playing locally with friends this game is worthless.

Have played about 3 hours so far and am really happy with this game. World of Light is a really interesting way to keep the content fresh and the characters unlock at a steady pace.Definitely lived up to the hype.
ALL 63 characters* from past Smash Brothers game are included in this game+6 brand new characters

My preorder from another store came Thursday afternoon, so I've been playing with my kids for about eight hours. It totally lives up to expectations. It's in no way perfect, but there's just so much good that I don't see how anybody can be sad. It's a game I'm going to be playing for years, and I'm going to enjoy it for years. If you're a parent, your kids will love playing with all their friends. If you're a returning player, all the nostalgia and great Smash gameplay is here. If you're new to Smash, this is a great game to play with other people.When you first boot up, you'll have access to eight characters: Mario, DK, Link, Samus, Yoshi, Kirby, Starfox, and Pikachu. Unlocks happen pretty quick, but we'll see how long it takes to unlock all 74 characters. I love some of the new costumes like the Mario Wedding costume. I read an online unlock guide that said if you quit the game after unlocking a character and play another quick round that you'll unlock lots of characters quickly. When I say quit the game I mean to exit the game on the Switch home menu. That's worked well so I did that for a while on my Switch to unlock quickly so I could play with lots of characters. I didn't tell my kids about this because I want unlocking on their Switch to be more organic and slower.

Choosing for glory or for fun was crucial as it didnt force you to play with people who simply wanted to play the game casually online.Now we must set online preferences and hope we get an opponent with a similar set-up. Not only will you be in matches you didnt agree to be in, but they'll likely be free for all or 1v1 matches with ridiculous and different preferences each match.

This is one of those games where the creators really try to do their best to pack-in EVERYTHING in one tiny little cartridge for a standard price. The game has you start out with just EIGHT characters! If you've been caught up with the game and seen how it works, you already know that the character roster is INSANE. Hours upon hours will be spent unlocking everybody!

Visually it's great and tons of characters/stages but the overall concept of the game is shallow. Just a silly fighting game with zero depth. You do the same thing over and over and over.Biggest problem is that I cant play online with My FRIENDS against random other players. So sick of getting Nintendoed!

It's great they included all the characters but they got rid of half the game. No Stage Builder. No break the targets. No Home run Contest.  No For Glory Mode online. (The only one people care about) I bought the switch for this game and feel miserably let down. It seems like where it matters, they got rid of more than they added. Stage Builder was my personal favorite and For Glory was the only mode I played in Smash 4.  This is the first time I've seen Nintendo mess up this bad.

It's easy to be bitter over the minutiae of what's missing, what's different, etc. But the fact is, this is undeniably the best total Smash Bros package to date. It's massive, it's superbly polished, and it's seemingly boundless in its content. The first couple of days with this game have taken me back to the sentiments I had when first experiencing Melee on the GameCube, and that's a phenomenon I haven't enjoyed since 2001. I'm 36, and it's like I'm a kid again.The best aspects of the series have been distilled down to what initially seems almost certainly the best-balanced installment to date. The action is swift, the characters and stages are seemingly neverending, and the music... 850 songs spanning dozens of franchises from different companies in gaming history. Unreal.
I'm not a competitive player so I picked the characters I enjoyed the most of Smash History.This is my Top 10 Favorite Super Smash Bros Fighters of all time.

I was so excited to play this game because I had never played it before and I heard great things about it. I had also just purchased my switch and this was one of the first games I purchased for it. I went to open it and noticed that the plastic wrapping around it was a little bit loose but I didn’t pay much attention to it. I opened the box and saw nothing. There was no game in it. I looked online to see if this has happened to anyone else and apparently it does happen a lot. I immediately started the refund/return process and sent it back ASAP. I sent it back on March 25 and am waiting to get my money refunded.

Pros:The World of Light adventure mode is fantastic. Not only is it really fun to play with the addition of a progression system with the spirits, skill tree, and unlocking more fighters, but it also quite long and will take you many hours to fully play through. I actually quite enjoyed the spirit system and the many different spirit fights seem diverse enough that it doesn't really start to bore me. Maybe the only problem is the varied difficulty of fights. Most fights are insanely easy after you have a decent full leveled spirit, even on the highest difficulty, but you can always purposefully handicap yourself by using a weaker spirit if that's your thing.  But also some of the fights were so insanely difficult and unfair that switching down to "easy" mode still made the fight take me 30 minutes of replaying to beat (and I'm pretty decent at the game).  Honestly it wasn't even a downside for me I enjoyed the challenge and it wasn't a necessary fight for progressing.

I never played the original, so have nothing to compare this to.With all the hype, I was expecting more, but I was indifferent about this game (maybe I'm just old, original Atari era gamer). This has so much going on at times, its nigh impossible to see what is going on.

Imagine you are playing one of those popular Call of duty games that all the kids are playing now adays. Now imagine you want to play team deathmatch, you tell the game that all you want to do is play team deathmatch but instead it keeps aggressively rubbing your crotch with a cheese grinder until all that is left is the bloody pulp of what used to be your manhood. Steer clear of this game for now if you are trying to have any sort of skill based online gameplay. All that you are going to find here is ffa with all items turned on. Tldr: 5/5 game ruined by Nintendo's ineptitude with anything that connects to the interwebs.

This is my first smash bros game of any kind on any platform. I haven't played it for very long and even then only the single player "story mode", no local or network multiplayer.I don't usually get into fighting games but I decided to give this a try (there was that brief phase with "killer instinct" in 90s but lets not count that).

I've been playing Smash Bros. since the N64 days and it's been great watching the evolution of the franchise. There have been stepbacks, especially with Brawl, but each iteration brings something new and unique to the playing field. Smash Ultimate is more than that as it brings most of everything from all Smash games and THEN some.Technically, this game is gorgeous to play on a big screen and portable mode and 99.9% of the time, runs at a stable 60fps. Lag inputs are somewhat of an issue compared to older titles, but it's something I've gotten used to (still hoping for a patch).

It was a lot different than I thought and that's in a bad way. First impression was the interface. The menu screen and the rest of the selection menus are incredibly dull-looking and honestly just ugly. It's grrat that it's easy to navigate, but I was a little let down on the interface. Secondly, online play is laggy, huge disappointment, sometimes nearly unplayable. I did not have this issue for brawl. Thirdly, we're severely limited in character selection for online play. This definitely applies to co-op mode online (not sure with single player) teams, but in order to change your character, you have to exit out and quit playing with the same opponents? Again this wasn't the case with brawl. This is such a stupid hassle and I don't understand why Nintendo would even do this. Also I would like to have the option to play with multiplayer mode online with friends. It's ridiculous how it's only single player and my siblings can't join in on the fun for battle arena. Moving on, World of Light was fun for the first 10 minutes, then I realized how repetitive and boring it was, epecially with the lack of a promising story. Attempting to obtain 4* through spirit battle are nearly impossible--it's pure luck if you win, but you'll be bummed if you miss your shot trying to "steal and awaken" the spirit from the statue. Last but not least, why was the option to create custom stages removed?
First time for Smash series. It  is very much fun including online play.I played Pokken a lot on Switch and Soul Calibur 6 on PC/PS4. I love Tekken 7 too.

As of this point, I have positive feelings about the game. World of Light isn't Subspace Emissary levels of good, but it offers enough to make this game worth revisiting 10 years from now. Classic mode is very carefully thought out, giving a small story so every one's story is themed. The cast is loaded and it's mostly a buffed up version of Smash for Wii U/3DS. My only issues as of this point is: Final Smashes suck, they are about half as strong as they were in Brawl, and most are stupid cutscenes or things that restrict your control. Online as of this point (3/14/19) sucks as well. I don't know what Nintendo is doing, but we went from 4 player matches loaded with items running smooth on the Wii U version, to lag city on 1 v 1 no items Final Destination.

Update: Some improvement has been made since launch. Online still needs some fixes, but still much better than before. upgrading from 1 star to 4.Game feels unfinished. Tons of bugs, and the online is embarrassingly bad. I bought a switch just for smash bros, as I’ve been a smash fan since N64.

This game is absolutely lacking in logic and extremely frustrating to play. Do not recommend. Unfair to the player and biased towards CPU. Has too much nerdy lingo going on to comprehend and remarkably complicated to be marketed as a children’s game. I have to record the gameplay and rewatch just to understand what has happened to be defeated and still am often left bewildered and red in the face

Look, I tried to give smash a chance I really did. It's boring and I don't understand the hype for this game. The movements are stiff and it's far from smooth. For months people hyped this game up. I wasted 52.00 dollars on a mediocre game. You only have 4 moves !! Amazon you get 5 stars for delivering my games on time. Lol

I've always been a Smash fan.  Had the 64 version and the Game Cube version.  Loved both to death, but missed out on any others in between due to limited budget in college.  Once I got the Switch when it came out, I was chomping at the bit for when this would come up!I love how many characters you have to select from once you unlock them.  Its also fun to play the single player Light quest mode.  I found my brother and I unlocked most of the roster working together and taking turns.  I also love the customization you can make to matches when you're playing against friends or the computer!  Changing maps randomly is a fun feature!  I know the Assist Trophy's are an addition in one of the games I missed, but between them and the pokemon roster you can get from the different pokeballs can make the entire match crazy if that's all you have selected to spawn.  It's great fun all around!

I bought this as a Christmas gift for myself.  This is easily the only reason I bought a Nintendo Switch initially (I recently received a few Switch games for Christmas as well).The game is incredibly fun.  The Adventure mode takes you around a huge map where you collect 'spirits' that aid you in battle while you unlock your main fighting characters who have been trapped by evil.  When you think the Adventure Mode over and you beat the game - guess again.  You'll see what I'm talking about!

The latency in this game made it a trashfire for me personally. Yeah I'm coming from a melee background. And if you tell me I'm spoiled I'll tell you that things should get better not worse and you're the reason searching for a movie on amazon and netflix sucks. Because scrolling to a file in an alphabetically list and clicking it which takes 2 seconds was somehow, to you, less preferable than taking 7 minutes to get your tv remote to painstakingly land on Twilight on your streaming services when you were actually trying for Titanic. Admit it, the Apple spearheaded gaudy-square ui that infects everything now was more preferable to your lazy narcissism than selecting from simple raw data and that's why we're all doomed. That's why capitalism is allowed to take away user's right to easily perform maintenance on their own devices. They distracted you with an Idiocracy level ui where you can push pretty buttons and you gave up the entire logic center of your brain with no complaint.ANYWAY I have beef with a bunch of Ultimate.  Here's a main one: Screwing with the screen in 50 different ways during play is not a game mechanic. It's bad game design and there's no way to avoid it in the single player. You limit who you play with when you have to set flags for "yeah stop putting an insulting giant dog graphic over the screen when people are playing and calling it a feature." Single player is especially heinous with this crap.

First Smash game I’ve played since the N64 one. There are a lot of hidden mechanics and things to master in this game. A lot of the reviews on Amazon are so harsh it’s actually funny. I really am enjoying this and am learning how to master aspects of it all the time. Great to play with other people online and on the couch!
Amazing game. If you're a fan of the Smash series, it is well worth it.

Tuve problemas con el producto ya que la primera vez que lo recibí el juego no estaba adentro del empaque sellado, sin embargo hice el reclamo y me enviaron al instante un reemplazo. Es un excelente juego, con muy buenos gráficos y un concepto nuevo del viejo smash

I always take my switch whenever we go somewhere far with my little cousins. When they are bored as hell when their cell phones are taken away, I just pop my switch out with super smash, oh man, they swarm you like little hungry mosquito. So many characters to choose from and intense fighting, make them joyful for many hours. I also grew up playing smash on N64 and I can easily join them and play together. Thank you nintendo for making this great game and I really appreciate this.

I and my bros have made the full transition from Brawl to Ultimate. I love the large selection of character and variety of stages to choose from. Figure players also add to the gaming experience with their unique adaptive personalities!I am very glad single player was brought back in this rendition, though I’m a little disapointed that it’s no more than a map of arranged CPU battles instead of the classic side-scrollers like in Brawl’s Subspace Emissary. I’m also sad they removed 15 minute brawl as well as the custom stage builder. I still have Brawl I can fall back to for these features, but I would have really like to try the new characters on these. Maybe in a future update or extension? Fingers crossed.

Well I’ll try to give this a serious review. This Smash iteration is the most polished out of them all. The game just works. For comparison, Melee had too many glitches which is what made it competitive, Brawl had too little hit stun and was too slow to do any combos at all and Meta Knight was just ridiculous, Smash For 3ds/Wii U had some combos but it really rewarded defensive play but you’ll find a compromise with all of that in Super Smash Bros. Ultimate. If you want to play a party game this is it for you and also if you like to play competitively this is also for you. At first it was very weird getting into the game because of the new engine but when you get used to it. You’ll be able to zoom all over the place and just land hits reliably although not too recklessly. The only issue I have with this game so far is there’s a slight hint of delay with the joy cons. I have my TV set to game mode which the game recommends and also there’s a lot of buffer. What I mean by buffer is let’s say you press A to attack, and then you input a jump on accident after the attack. The game will still register what you input first so instead of doing any other action you jump instead. It got in the way of continuing my combos but I don’t think it’s too much of a problem. Hopefully it’ll be patched soon.

Smash is usually at its most fun when you're playing with friends. But as you grow up, the likelihood of living near your friends who would be willing to play Smash lowers, so you usually play it solo. I'm happy to report that this Smash has a really engaging solo-player aspect, mainly in the form of the World of Light campaign and spirit board challenges.While not as good as Brawl's Subspace Emissary in terms of story, it definitely has more interesting content and just lots of content in general. I was bummed when the previous gen of Smash didn't have as robust of a single player experience and non of it had any kind of story, but the World of Light has both.

Love this game, from the improvements from Smash 4 to the Light World campaign.  All of the characters feel much more balanced, it's nice to have characters like Zelda and Donkey be competitive again.  BUT!  Online makes me want to drive my head into a 3 brick wide wall, 3 wide just to make sure I die from my injuries trying to break it down.  It's incredibly inconsistent, not just from match to match, but second to second within each match.  This is a huge portion of the game for me since I love playing against all different types of players and styles, and it is 100% garbage.  Unless they fix this I don't see me playing it much into the new year.

There is no chance whatsoever of playing with anyone online. The game lags so horribly, you'll be grabbing someone one second, and the next second you'll be off the screen because they apparently smashed you. Check the real reviews online, away from Amazon. Online play is horrible. Nintendo needs to synchronize a little better amigo.

Let's face it. You didnt buy the switch because of legend of zelda, mario odyssey, splatoon, mario kart, or pokemon. You bought the switch because once you saw the the Smash Bros first trailer you could feel your inner child screaming at the top of its lungs.How to describe this game? Imagine taking the wiiu (3ds) smash bros, balancing some character attacks and adding melee (gamecube) tactics into the mesh. Oh, and then put every character ever made for smash bros into the fighting roster while adding 4 new characters totalling 74 playable characters. Let's top it off by saying theres no locked characters behind a pay wall. The CEO of capcom could take notes from this practice to rebuild its fanbase from previous titles while having characters associated in smash.

FANTASTIC game.  I've already put in 20 hours and still haven't unlocked everyone, it's just incredibly deep.  The gameplay is fast and aggressive - campers will be punished.  The animation is slick, the movements are smooth, and the fighters are all incredible.  Just an absolute masterpiece of a game, the pinnacle of the series, and the crown jewel for the Nintendo Switch.  You can't say you own a Switch if this game isn't in your library!EDIT: A couple hundred hours later, and the game is still fantastic.  The roster is well balanced, the characters are fun, and the gameplay can be as deep or as shallow as you want.  Want to just have fun with family & friends or a good party game?  This game is for you! Want a deep fighter with a high skill ceiling?  You can find that here!  The online portion is full of players trying very hard to be competitive.  Basically anyone can find something to enjoy - if you own a Switch, you NEED to own this game

Wanted to love this game, but as a person who buys these games for the vast assortment of characters to play with it’s extremely annoying to find out you only start with 8 and have to unlock the rest. I simply don’t have the time or the patience to do this the normal way, and even using a method to speed up the process, beating the characters to unlock them is WAY too hard. I’d say I only unlock about 2 out of every 10 I fight. I bought this to just enjoy the game, but it’s hard to enjoy it when I’m spending all my time just trying to unlock the characters I actually want to play with.

This game is vastly improved from the Wii u version because it doesn't have unfair difficulty. Classic mode was a joke in smash for wii u. Classic mode and adventure provide a challenge without being unfair. the vast selection of characters and stages are another one of the stronger points. Stage select could have been easier to navigate through though.  The fighting mechanics have been polished to make it more fair.I love adventure mode and its story. Something that smash for wii u lacked.

Very very fun game. Im not the biggest in for smash players but I do own the n64 and the gamecube versions. I missed out on the wii and wii u but this game makes up for it. Its basically all out with the cherry on top.My favorite characters are in the games so Im pretty happy with who I wanna play with. The online is fun but I do gotta play more to get better. I have heard of people having some problems with online issues like slow down but I havent ran into that problem yet.

In my mind 5 out of 5 better be AMAZING or PERFECT. Ultimate is GREAT, in my eyes at least. Every fighter from the games before and new fighters come in to give the player an impression of the best that they can be. Some are better and some are worse (Little Mac but every fighter has a different profile of strengths and weaknesses that everyone can appreciate and not find frustrating to play. The new "system" has features that pros can appreciate but won't distract or discourage new players. Overall, it is coming off as the best Smash game.Now here is my ONLY let down: World of Light feels grindy, boring, and I would REALLY much rather have sub space emissary from brawl, or adventure mode from Melee, or; better yet, more bosses for Classic mode would make this game AMAZING. I understand that they wanted to do something new and the symbolism, as well as the end of the game, are great. I am just not a fan of running into battle after battle equipping spirits for each and every encounter (same or less power level spirits give better rewards, so I was trying that). Others like me have eventually just choose one team and use them for the rest of the game instead of adjusting the spirit team.
Some characters are just plain broken (the Belmonts just feel like such cheeseball characters to play)I hate the dynamic camera and there's no option to turn it off.

First I must say the graphics is breathtaking, but this is supposed to be the Ultimate meaning final, but where's the missing games? What missing games? Well on the GameCube version of Super Smash Brothers Melee there was a BREAK THE TARGET, and a HOMERUN CONTEST game in single player mode that just is not there is this Ultimate version for the Switch, so how can you say this new Smash Brothers is better than the low tech Gamecube's Smash Brothers? I don't know, but when you buy the newer version you just kinda of expect that all the games would be included.  I'd have given this only two stars, but the graphics was very good to earn the 3 stars, thanks for reading my review, but if those games are there, and I'm just over looking them, please send me a comment letting me know what I'm doing wrong, thanks again.

I was really excited for this game. Normally I don't care too much about games, I buy the ones I think will be fun, and leave it at that. This, however, was very different. I now didn't need to choose which game I wanted to play, because all the characters are available. Of course there are changes, but I'm a very casual player, so Im not really affected by them. I also like that now you can play on any map in any form essentially. This makes it more fun to do a random map without worrying about a place like 'temple' coming up. Unlocking all the characters was such a journey, but well worth it. I do wish I tried out other characters during that time so I can learn their moves, but I was just trying to unlock them first...so I only know like 5 characters, but with all the echo fighters, and other just pretty similar fighters, it shouldn't be much of an issue, and like I said, very casual gamer here. Can't wait for the online to actually start working properly so I can see how bad I actually am

Tons of characters are only attainable in DLC packs, of which there are many. Good game though, just tired of paying through the nose to get part of a game and then having to pay more to get the rest.

Solid game. Many great characters and counting. Negatives would be the lack of any non-fighting mode. Was hoping for another Home Run mode at least. I would've preferred they work on incorporating a non-fighting minigame than add more characters to this already great roster I haven't even played all the characters with yet. Was very disappointed after beating the World of Light to find there was nothing else to do but fight in every other game mode. Also the World of Light has steep variances in difficulty. I had to switch to easy to beat certain spirits, but switch to medium or hard to get a decent challenge out of the unlockable fighters and boss battles.Pros

I didn't really find it particularly enjoyable like everybody else did mostly because the characters feel even harder to control than the previous game I do like the fact that you have to unlock almost every character in the game I guess but that means you're required to spend at least 10 hours unlocking characters. And there's no guarantee within that 10 hours period that you're going to unlock every character. But considering in the adventure mode the first character you're able to use his Kirby witch honestly I don't like Kirby kind of kills it for me I would have honestly preferred anybody else first in the adventure mode

First off the game definitely has potential, but the Online is atrocious. For starters, you have to pay separately for online unlike Ninentdo’s previous online systems. This wouldn’t be so bad if the online itself was well executed, but it’s awful. You can request a 1 vs 1 match, yet end up in a 4-player Free For All with items on everywhere. Oh, and if you disconnect from the game you didn’t want? That’s a penalty, so no more online for you for a while!The game also has some awful balancing. Characters like Inklings, Bowser, and Charizard are ridiculously overpowered. It makes playing “worse” characters not fun at all.

I grew up on Smash Bros. Melee for the Gamecube. I never adjusted to Brawl and never owned a Wii U. I did however get a switch and after waiting for initial reviews decided it was time to have Smash on my switch.What can I say? I love this game. As an occasional gamer, I get a lot of value out of this game. I personally focus on classic mode and unlock a lot of elements of the game through the classic matches (new characters, music, etc (it has a story mode as well which is fine but not my focus). As of 2019, you can use the gamecube controller for this game with an adapter (which I have yet to try but expect it to be fantastic).

The most cringy, salty, and flat out toxic fan base I’ve ever seen.Can’t believe I’m saying it for a smash game but it’s true. The community is literally full of creeps who will gladly try to take the fight to RL, probably just because you criticized their favorite obscure character.

No se podía esperar más de este producto es excelente. Te diviertes bastante gracias a las opciones que presenta la Nintendo switch si tienes 2 pares de controles pueden jugar 4 personas lo que lo hace muy divertido. Una amplia galería de personajes jugables y aparte una amplia galería de personajes de apoyo con los que puedes variar tu estrategia. Aparte cuenta con distintos modos de juego que harán que disfrutes tanto jugando solo como acompañado....

Everything except the core gameplay is amazing. Plenty of gamemodes, great look and feel, all the characters and stages are there, everything is top-notch.For any new or returning Smash player who just wants to have a great time with their buddies: 5 stars; stop reading and buy the game now.

This game is a mess. The developers tried to cram a whole bunch of crap into this game. Not to seem like I'm living in the past... but the Super Smash Bros games for the N64 / Gamecube were much much better. This one has a single player mode called Adventure Mode, which is a headache. The whole spirit thing they've added in this game probably ought not to be there. The graphics are pretty good, admittedly, although sometimes the screen is such a jumbled chaotic mess that you'll strain your eyes trying to track your characters' position in the map.Anyway, this was fifty bucks wasted for me. Your mileage may vary.

So I won't go into what makes this a better Super Smash Brothers. Most of us already know that it has an insane amount of characters in it. An insane amount of levels. Better gameplay then Super Smash Brother Brawl and I would rank it as this almost the same game play as Super Smash Brothers U. Out of Super Smash Brothers games, it's easily my favorite besides The Golden Child of Super Smash Brothers Melee. My real issue with this game comes to what they didn't give us. It's is a small complaint. I'm really sad that we didn't get a home run contest or break the targets. I miss the trophies that you would get and how you could spend time just looking at them. I get why they're not in there. This game is huge. I like that they put in a story mode. Then again I also wish it was more like brawl when it came down to that story mode. It would also have been nice if the story mode came with a two player option. Overall this game was in the right direction. Every issue I have with it is just my issue. I'm still loving the game
If you’ve never played smash before or are a super casual gamer this game is not for you. It is incredibly difficult and unforgiving with no tutorial.

Had a delivery snafu and ended up having to get a refund from Amazon, but I was able to get the game digitally through the eshop (14GB for those wondering). I am absolutely stunned by the amount of content in this game! It has the nostalgia and simplicity of the earlier entries in the series but there’s so much to do and unlock between the many different game modes and the challenges that it feels completely brand new. The roster is huge, but you only start with the original 8 characters. However, you begin to unlock new ones very quickly. Not sure if there’s any method to how you unlock certain characters, but they’re coming along at such a steady pace that I should get to my favorites without a hassle. The level selection menu is a little overwhelming so I tend to just stick it on random. The Adventure mode map is HUGE and will likely keep me busy for many hours to come. Online is pretty seamless for matchmaking with strangers but the inability to directly message or invite friends is a little cumbersome. Also, relying on the phone app for voice chat is just ridiculous. I like that it limits my kids online interactions but it makes it so much more difficult than it should be.

Delivered on Release Day and currently playing it and it rocks. It’s so good that I bought several copies for my other friends who couldn’t afford to get it on launch day due to being broke from Cyber Monday shopping. It does really bring backs nostalgic feeling once again with the Smash games combine into one(technically). Here is my own opinion/review on the game.Pros:

this game has the most bang for your buck. full price tag with all the dlc would be about $120 but you get 86 characters, 114 stages, 900+ songs, several modes that provide hours of entertainment. challenges to complete. and a wealth of online community content and online play. this is a game where having multiple controllers comes in handy. if you have a few GameCube controllers lying around they are great here. the biggest cons are that spirits themselves seem more lazy than trophies from past games but the challenges to get them are fun. its also much more fun to play with people who are about the same skill level as you, so if your new, play with other new people. this is the best smash bros game and you wont be dissapointed.

First of all let me start off with saying that my switch is a part of the day one releases so this might not apply to newer switches. I got the game on release day and decided to try and play it right away. When I first put it in it asked me to do an update. After the update finished I found myself stuck on the startup screen and can no longer get past this screen and I can't enter safe mode as well. Currently I am trying to wait the battery out and see if that helps at all, and if that doesn't work there is probably nothing else I can do to keep my save data. Currently I only use licensed Nintendo products with my switch and this update that I had to do before I could load the game is the only culprit I can think of.

Got this for my super dope 30-year-old brother who wanted this for Xmas. I only had to buy this one thing. And he loved it. It was very unexciting, though. Only one present. It was $60... I'm not gonna get him more than this, you know? But I felt bad, like, sorry you don't have more presents to open, but, I mean... this was expensive. SO I'd recommend this if you like this game (I wouldn't know how the game is, only how it is received as a present/makes 30-year-old Gamer/IT Programmers feel @ Christmas) or if you need to get on the good side of some nerd. Just kidding. Happy Holidays.

Definitely my favorite Smash Bros entry of the entire series. One could even say it's the "Ultimate" version of the game. It can be played for hours with friends and I've even enjoyed playing on my own, though that isn't quite as fun as playing with a group of friends and family.I will admit it can be a confusing game to jump right in to if you've never played a Smash Bros game before. However, it can be enjoyed by little kids and adults alike. Make sure to watch the "How to Play" video after the intro to the game to get a basic idea of how the game works. These games have a pretty unique take on the fighting game genre, so I'll leave a basic summary below.

Smash Ultimate is the best-looking game on the Switch in hand-held mode. This is the definitive mobile version of Smash, and it runs beautifully.The single player content is outstanding. While I thought World of Light was decent, Spirit Board is an addicting collectible mode for people like me who want to pick-up-and-play. Each character getting their own themed Classic Mode is also really cool. One of my favorite changes is that the challenges aren't totally brutal overall. No "complete X mode with every character" stuff.

A fighting game like this with all 70 characters to choose from make a game so Exciting. But who knows if this is the last Super Smash Bros game? Who knows if a another one is on the way? Apparently their were other fighting games that came about compared to SSMB but they didn't  succeed to be better than SSMB. If this turns out to be the last one I guaranteed that their will be remake if necessary. I still have the SSMB for the 3DS and Wii U but no need for me play them anymore. I couldn't even play the one my Wii U anymore after I had to delete to make room for extra memory. When I tried reinstall it to play it again an Update was due but I didn't have enough memory so I never able to play it again. I was lucky that I still had on my 3DS. But now this has arrived I'll never get rid of it ever. Then again who knows if this is the last Super Smash Bros game?
My kids love it !!! Excellent game for Nintendo Switch !!!

Sakurai is loved for this series. And players should see why once they've experienced the flood of content in this game.Competitive and DLC packs seem to be where their effort is right now. Online is an improvement, but is still not enjoyable for most people due to input delay.

The game is great and reminds me of previous versions, but it has much better graphics, performance and responsiveness than previous versions.  The amount of levels and characters with unique traits and moves is astounding.  The music and sound effects are also great and all of the positive attributes of this game make it addicting to play.  I will be playing this on the train to work for a long time.

I've always loved playing the Smash Bros series but this game is so much more. I started playing Smash Bros Ultimate as soon as it came in, since then my girlfriend left me (because I forgot I had one), my cat ran out of food and started eating my legs because he thought I had died, and I almost passed out because of a horrible smell in my house but came to realize that that smell was me. On the bright side, I have lost a few pounds because I haven't eaten in over a week now. Please send help!

This is a much much better game than smash 4, it’s almost like melee but more refined. It’s a faster pace game than brawl was and smash 4. The amount of characters to choose from in this game is one of part of the game and every character seems like reasonably balanced, there are a few exceptions now and there but that’s to be expected. There is no such thing as perfect, at least in my opinion, but this iteration of smash is as close to it as any of the ones before it.

If you've played a Smash Bros game then you know what to expect.  This version has more characters than ever, with all the characters who have ever been playable in Smash coming back.  Nearly all the stages are back as well, and tons of music too.  Smash Ultimate plays a bit more quick than the 3DS/WiiU versions did, making the game more fast paced in general.Lots of stuff to unlock, and just so much fun to play with friends.  The online component is a bit iffy at times, but it's been improving.

This game is so fun! My kids love it and have enjoyed playing the game and unlocking more characters. I can also say that it has caused some contention around our household, but the game encourages you to get better. My 5 year old couldn't help but call it Smusher Smash, so that is the name it is know as around our household.Fun game play and very enjoyable.

What more could be said? It's pretty much the ultimate version of Smash bros. Tons of characters to unlock, an amazing adventure mode featuring spirits we know and love. Plus, classic mode! Do you have what it takes to reach the end?As for the online some have had good experiences some bad. You know how it goes first few days of a game?

Story mode was a solid 20 hours or so of gameplay and I loved every bit of it. You start out as Kirby and then get to battle and win every character. There are way more than in other games and a lot of fun moves to discover.A couple of the dungeons were confusing and took a glance on the Google to figure out but eventually got them completed.

My son worked hard to earn money to purchase this game so you can imagine his disappointment when he took the packaging off and opened the case to see that there was NO game card in it! I called Nintendo and spent close to an hour being put on hold. I am a busy single mom of two young boys and so I have elected to replace it through Amazon. But I have read online of numerous accounts of this happening to others. Nintendo will say that they measure the case prior to shipping but others have said the weight difference is insignificant. Nintendo needs to be made aware of this ongoing issue. Honest people are being scammed. I hope the replacement game has the actual card in it. I'll update my review on our results.

If you never played a smash bros game, this would be the best time to get this game, it has everyone from past smash bros games, with a few new characters and really good amount of stages. I play this game with my 5 year old nephew and he loves it, I just love to sit with him and play for hours unlocking new characters, the memories this game makes in itself is well worth it and something money can't buy.

DOnt really care for all the other characters or online dont even play the switch online any way only one reason why i get super smash bros is my beloved samus aran crazy for her got everthing for switch samus aran skins controller stickers cases posters figures amiibos shirts custom made jackets helmets everything possible did i mention im a really big big big fan of samus aran oh yea i did and yes thats why i buy smash bros only for her and this game playing on tv or car i can go with her every were lol 5 star and got my copy yesterday from amazon thanks

I've been playing Smash since the first one. I was pretty close to pro level in Brawl (I know it's not great, you don't need to tell me). This one is absolutely incredible. The mechanics have been tweaked enough to differentiate it from Smash 4. The character roster is absolutely insane. WOLF IS BACK!!!! Their are only two negatives here: 1) The mini games (break the targets, board the platforms, home run contest, etc.) are gone 2) World of Light is pretty meh.This is a must have for any Nintendo Switch owner.

Super smash bros ultimate is one of the best smash bros ive played. I threw two parties this weekend and everybody had tons of fun playing it to where two of my friends are going to buy a switch just for this game. There is a lot of new stuff like characters maps spirits and game modes. A con for former smash bros players is that its going to feel repetitive because at the end of the day you use the same character you always use on your favorite map. But for new people it is a must have.

This game is amazing! If you own a switch and enjoy fighting games then you need this one! I consider it to be a must have switch game right alongside breath of the wild, splatoon 2 and Mario odyssey!I haven't been able to put it down for long since receiving it.

Great game! Haven’t played since N64 edition. Brings back great memories.FYI N64 controllers can take more abuse. If you are losing Switch controllers can’t handle throwing. If you flick it. Towards a pillow/couch a few times you are safe. Throw with a floor skip and walk smash not so much.

Even in a year with games such as God of War, Spider-Man, and Read Dead Redemption 2 this was still my most anticipated game of the year. It has met all of my expectations for a Smash game, and I would recommend it to any fan of the series. The game has every character ever in a Smash game, over 100 stages, and also looks beautiful. Smash Ultimate plays a lot faster than Brawl or WiiU/3DS, but not as fast as Melee. It is a great middle ground for fans of the series. The only downside right  now is the state of the online infrastructure. Many games can be laggy when playing online, especially in 4 player matches as one player's bad internet connection can hinder the experience for the rest of the players. This, however, has not detracted from my personal enjoyment of the game as I generally play with friends in-person, but if you plan to play online a lot I would keep the current sub-par online experience in mind.

I gifted my daughter Smash Bro’s as an early Christmas present. We realized our switch was stolen. We held each other and cried.She lost all her game play in Zelda and I’m not going to spend Christmas break playing smash bros with my girl.

***READ BEFORE JUDGING ME***Ok The Game is Amazing. The Controls are excelent and feels great and the game is best but the copy i recieved was awful. The game care could not read until I tried reinserting a bunch of times. Then when it did read the game had a corrupt data problem with me having to redownload so many times until finally it worked but I still have to redownload and repeat until the game works. I guess I recieved a “bad apple” copy but this makes me want to go digital.

We bought this for our daughters' Christmas last year, and we think they ceased to play all other games momentarily. This game had my girls, aged 11 & 13, playing and giggling together like best friends, which I loved. They spent all their waking, free hours playing it, which I did not love. This game is the reason for our current game time limits, which were not needed before we got this game. I do not know whether that is due more to their ages or this game...judging from the chatter about it with other kids, though, I tend to think it was the game. ;)

This is fun overall but not a five star game by any means. It is more like a 3.5 so I just rounded to 4 but the kids played a good bit the first week then its fun started to fizzle out. In comparison, I bought a few games for a stay-at-home stimulus package. Most of the games cost much less than this one and they are playing two so far. One for one-third the price of this one is being played by everyone for weeks now. Again this is a good game but they wanted more variety it seems.

I bought the console just for this, and it was well worth it. If you have ever played any of the previous titles than this is nostalgia at its finest. If not, then you will see why so many have fallen in love with the series, and a cult following has developed. The best choice characters Nintendo and beyond in an all out war. The perfect fighting game for anyone who doesn't care for the rigid format of traditional fighting games of the day

This game has the most stages and characters in smash bros. history. A downside is the small amount of new stages. For single player content we have world of light which can give people dozens of hours of fun and classic mode which is the best it's ever been. For multilayer there are welcome new additions like stage morph and the FS meter which makes it more accessible to new customers. And this is a huge video game crossover with so many iconic video game characters and franchises represented here. The music libary is the best smash has ever had with easier ways to your favorites and a huge pool of classic and modern video game tunes. Graphically this game looks much better than smash for Wii u. A consequence of that is that it is easier to lose track of your character. More things that were disappointing is the race to the finish in classic mode and missing several classic modes like break the targets and home run contest. World of light can also be repetitious at times. But overall this is the best smash bros. game with the most content and is the easiest for newcomers to get into. I'm sure the competitive scene will be looked into maybe even more than smash 4 maybe even bigger since this is faster than that game. I would recommend this game to anyone who has a switch or are into nintendo or fighting games.

This review is focused on online play. As a beginner who has spent countless hours trying to get good at this game, online play is NOT built for beginners. Two critical flaws that need to be addressed:1) Matching based on rank - every player starts at a high rank and lowers if you lose. I've played at 2.5M rank (hard) and 20K rank (easy) and do not notice any difference in opponents abilities. I play people online and there is a clear distinction between beginner, intermediate, and expert players which is not reflected here.

This game is fun!  The adventure is alright but a little long.  However, if you like story modes you’ll enjoy it.  I’m just crunching through it so I can get all the characters.  This game is slot of fun though!  It’s beautiful and it will being in all the precious super smash bros and adds a few other features that gives you the best of both worlds.  If you’re a fan of super smash you need to get this game!  Online play is a fun bonus to when your buddies aren’t around.
Has all of the nostalgia of the old game, but with all the new flare!New characters, moves, and a great story mode.

I am most likely less than 1% of the buy experience, but caution of Super Smash replicas. I had initially thought that it was the actual Super Smash Bros. Ultimate but after further inspection by putting in the switch and the game cartridge itself, it turned out to be fake (I received a $15 game). Everything was imitated with a paper cover and also paper on the game itself. I was actually excited to receive this product (would have gave a 5) but the 1 star is just for my personal experience.

I was able to play for the first time for a couple of days and am having fun with it.What I liked - Everyone Is Here; the little shooting game at the credits roll; Daisy's inclusion; addition of Spirits

Been playing Smash since Melee came out and I have to say it's easily the best fighting gaming series out there. The director, Sakurai, never disappoints and I undoubtedly say Ultimate is the best in the series so far. It has almost everything a Smash fan can ask for and plenty to do to keep you busy on the game for hours upon hours. It has the biggest roster to date in the series and they're still adding more and balancing them out. Only thing the game is missing is more cutscenes and character interactions in its story mode and I'm disappointed that Waluigi isn't playable in it (AGAIN) but I'm hopeful Sakurai might troll us all like he always does and make Waluigi the last DLC character. Other than those 2 things, it's a near flawless game. 9/10.

It's fun and easy to learn. There is a huge roster, and most characters feel unique. I can play this on a 10 minute break, or an evening hosting friends.It's great that I don't feel like I have to play this connected to the base/TV to really enjoy it like some other games.

I've been a Smash fan since N64 and I consider this version just as great as all the others. There's plenty of improvements/changes over the last Smash with everything you love about this game series: all your favorite characters and stages, single player content that is enjoyable in small doses, and it will still be your go-to game for local multiplayer.As others have already ranted plenty about, the real killer of this game is the online. The "preferred rules" concept is terrible. You frequently can't play the type of stages you want, you can't change characters between battles, etc. etc., but I expect that to improve over time (it already did in the first patch). The real problem with the online... is you.

This game disgusts me. Nintendo legitimately hates their player base. The "online" in this game is a slap in the face and literally a step backwards in time. I hope you have fond memories of playing online games via Dial-Up. Just kidding, it's worse. Let me explain why...First, the online performance sucks. You'll lag. You'll cry. You'll keep playing and wonder why.

So far I am enjoying the game, I have tried a mix of the different modes, including the story mode, regular brawls (up to 8 fighters locally!), online, and the new Mii fighter creation, and have found all of these aspects to be well made so far. The only issue I have is the removal of features such as the target destruction/home run mode and one of my personal favorites, the stage builder. Used to play ridiculous custom stages in Smash Bros. Brawl all the time such as a stage completely enclosed in a box made up of spike floors with only a small hole to launch out of. I hope that Nintendo decides to add this back at some point in the game. I know not everyone used it, but is there really a point in taking out a game feature? I would have even been happy with the exact same builder from the Wii version. If added in a future DLC, I will return to revise this review.Edit: With the stage builder, I am now 100% satisfied! Updated to 5 stars.

It is one of my favorite games ever, I have been waiting for it to come out forever, and now that I have it I"m not disappointed at all. It's everything I wanted + more. For one Ridley is finally a player in smash and he looks perfect! I've had this game for 5 days and have already played for about 24 hours, and thats saying something becauseI usually only play 30 min a day.  Basically it is supper fun, It has a great story mode, smash mode, and so much more.  Before  my brother played it he  was like, meh that doesn't sound fun, but then he played it and he said that it was his 2nd or 3rd favorite video game. It is a supper fun family game if you are having a party, or still really fun if you want to play by yourself. I would recommend it for basically everyone (unless you don't do video games) Its a fun game just to pick up and play, but if you are supper competitive it is also really fun. I didn't have any smash games, but then I tried one at my friend's house and it was supper fun, so I was going to get a wii U (that's what he had) but then I realized that Nintendo was coming out  with a new smash for the Nintendo switch, so I bought a Nintendo switch and waited for what felt like 10 years but really was only one then I finally got it and so far it is a blast! For anyone who is looking for a fun game for your switch, or a game for someone who has a switch and dose not have this game I would highly recommend Supper smash bros ultimate. I say it is defiantly worth the $ . Reviewed by an 11yr old

This game is full of hundreds of hours of play. Although I wish world of light would have had more too it. I also wish that they would have kept hit the targets and homerun contest but you can't get it all. The game is a ton of fun and great with friends. Though the game is only fun when you have a ton of people playing. I also feel that their internet service still needs to be fixed. Way to much lag input problems and my other online games on other consoles do not have this problem. However even with these issues I love this game! Easily one of the best games on the nintendo switch.
This is a great game, with a lot of fun.But it is not an easy game.

My biggest issue with this game is simply keeping up with the characters.  The background moves and changes color, the camera moves in and out making the fighters very small at times.  It's just impossible to tell where you're at, if you're hitting anyone, or if you're getting hit.  Couldn't send back so I put it on ebay.
If you can find it on sale, get it.It's so easy to pick up but it will take a lifetime to master.

It's Smash that's portable, that includes every character ever included in a Smash game and has good physics (coming from someone who's last Smash was Brawl). The online has a few issues, but I stick to playing with friends in private online matches anyway so I don't really encounter many of those problems.

Still miserably balanced from Wii U, didn't fix anything that needed to be fixed. Adding more characters was the last thing it needed because it's now even worse, trimming the fat and making a better game was the missing improvement and they moved in the opposite direction. Don't commit a lot of time to it.The release of Joker shows that this is going to be another pay to win game like Smash 4.

I bought this product for my son’s Christmas present (Christmas 2019)  and because he had other games playing with, he just opened the game case this past weekend (April 11th) only to find that the game was not in the case. Maybe this was an oversight but I’m extremely disappointed as had he opened this at Christmas last year, it would have been disastrous.Please ensure that this doesn’t happen to other faithful and loyal Amazon clients or anybody.
Pre ordered a month in advance, while everyone got to play on opening day I had to wait 5 days later

Super Smash Bros Ultimate was a game that I’ve been looking forward to play, I’ve always love the Smash Bros franchise since the original N64. With new and old characters that I know and start playing. Wonderful game and perfect price for the game. I was originally gonna keep that money for another Figuarts, but I really need this game.

From the little bit that I've played, it's been amazing. The mechanics are good, the different characters that I have played are very different from each other. Even characters that are similar to each other each have their own differences in terms of moves and stats. It's very impressive. There is a single player campaign, but it isn't necessary to play to have a great experience.

My favorite Smash Bros game was from the Nintendo 64. I feel that this version is very well done. Some people feel that the card system associated with the single player mode is a little silly, but I feel that it adds a different spin on the regular game. I recommend this game for fans of the Smash Bros games.
Not even the pro controller will make you feel like you're in control. It feels mushy like playing on the Wii, this must be why Nintendo is pushing the game cube controllers.

Most of the time online works reasonably well, then sometimes it will be an absolute slideshow.  There is no reason whatsoever for the game to not judge somebody's connection speed and discourage them from playing if their connection is bad.  There is no reason for matchmaking to force two players into a game if their connection to the other is abysmal.

Not a review of the game itself.Bought a new sealed copy of the game and there was no game cartridge when I opened it.  Looked all around me to see if I accidentally dropped it somehow, but nope.  No cartridge and no booklet (if it even came with one).  Also tried to look for a download code but there was nothing of the sort.  Thats about $50 that I spent on literally nothing.

The story mode doesn’t beat SSBB and it should have multiplayer mode for story mode (spirits) but the majority of smash bros is regular brawls with friends and this game feels so much more polished and smoother than the older games. More balanced too besides the DLC characters and lil Mac

All I ever wanted out of a Smash game. Beautiful graphics. Strong mechanics. Lots to do. My wife and I are well over 100 hours into this game (most of that was spent brawling it out against each other while earning characters) and we are not even close to burnt out. Worth buying a switch just for this game? Yes. There are plenty of other titles that make the switch worth every penny, but this one is the MOAB of this system. (MOAB- an acronym for the United States military ordinance entitled “Mother of all Bombs.”)

I used to play this growing up so I got it for my 5 year old. He loves the combination of all the characters in one game. His two favorite types of games would be battling and adventure so this was perfect.We did have issues figuring out how to make it two player! Felt like that could have been better but other than that no complaints.

Way too much happening on the screen at one time. A real cluster, if you catch my drift. Seems harder than the originals. Lots of characters and levels. Its all just too much for my mind to handle anymore I suppose.

With so many characters to choose from you really can't ever go wrong love the fact that there is many different game modes so there's always something to do and the fact that it also has online play if you have the Nintendo switch online I can't really say anything bad about this game it is a must-have for families as a person that played the original N64 love it

I've played every single smash game since the n64. This is the best one yet. It combines the best of Melee, Brawl & Smash for Wii U. The single player mode is amazing on its own. Online is great as long as you have an ethernet adapter and you play with wireless controllers. I actually ended up settling on the Pro Controller which is working well for me, which is surprising because I was certain I would want to use the Gamecube controller & adapter. YMMV. But if you've been on the fence about this, GET THIS GAME.

Our grade school kids love this game!  My son is a huge gamer and his handwriting has improved significantly since playing this during 'tech time' ... It also keeps the mind sharp because it moves very fast and you have to make quick decisions to progress in the game.  Highly recommend!

Great for all ages! Packed with nostalgia and good old fashion character vs. character fighting. My boyfriend and I play for hours and when we take it places, it’s the life of the party. Probably the first game I didn’t feel guilty paying $70 bucks for. If you’re a Nintendo fan at all, you’ll be happy you made the investment.

I'm writing this review on behalf of my teenage son, who ordered this game. When I asked him what he thought of the game, he said," It's a beautiful game." I honestly have never heard that said of a game before and I had to laugh. But he takes his videogaming seriously. He loves this new version of Super Smash Brothers and has even set up a tournament with his friends with a Super Smash Brothers Ultimate game as the prize for the winner.

Next to BOTW, I think this is next best game in the entire Switch collection.Spirit mode is a great addition to the game. It takes a while to complete and it's not all that easy. It gets a little repetitive but still good.

I love the faster pace of this game and the single player is very addicting. I was slightly disappointed that subspace emissary didn't make a return but world of light is still great. I am surprised by how addicting it is to collect spirits and create op combos and teams. It is very satisfying to beat a legendary spirit and i like the new classic mode (although i do wish there was a way to randomize who you are going to face and a different bonus stage would've been much appreciated. The online is still a little laggy but its miles ahead of what it used to be and is actually quite playable. Lack of dedicated party system is disappointing but not unexpected from Nintendo since they always seem to lag behind their competitors in terms of multiplayer. Overall this is a great game and the best smash game since melee.

I’d probably give this four stars if online was good, but, unfortunately, it is a terrible lagfest without a true 1v1 mode. I dock another star because the game play is a bit too simple. Characters have very little depth and it is difficult to differentiate yourself from other players due to the lack of options.

My 8-year-olds requested this game for their birthday.  They LOVE this game, however, they request the light stays on at night.  Some of the characters are quite scary.  Next time I'll stick to the suggested age on the front...My bad.
Opened my SEALED copy and discovered there was no game cartridge included.  Absolutely mental that this is even a possibility.  Looking at the reviews, this isn't even that uncommon.  Unbelievable.
