My son is enjoying the game, FWIW. But I hate Nintendo. Why do I have 7 different kinds of accounts, and I could not download this title until I straighted them out. Also, now we need a monthly subscription account to play core elements of the game that I already bought? Thanks Nintendo.

Definitely one of my favorite Switch games! Co-Op in Battle Arena needs to included in an update because playing co-op online shouldn't just be obligated to Quick Plays. There was co-op online against other friends in Brawl and Wii U/3DS, so there should be no reason to exclude it in Ultimate. I hope to see it included very soon (yes Nintendo, I'm implying that you're going to do this or keep getting fan complaints to where you'll be forced to). Other than that and the online matchmaking itself, playing locally is great and the World of Light adventure mode is pretty cool!

It's the next Smash Bros. game. It's beautiful and amazing and very well done. Creating rules and picking stages becomes 10x easier. A new adventure mode has been introduced. All around an amazing game!Online though is currently in a bad place. There is no standard ruleset anymore. If you are trying to play online in a competitive sense, you may as well give up. You have a *PREFERRED RULESET*. This means that the game will attempt to match you up with players with a similar ruleset. So if you wanted to do a 1v1 with 3 stocks, no items, and on battlefield then you would put that in your preferred ruleset. However you could be placed in a FFA, items, and 5 stocks, 2 minute time limit. Here's hoping online changes!

I've played all past variations of Smash Bros, well into the late night, for many many hours. This one is by far my favorite. Plus, if you don't know how to play, you can make it crazy enough that your chances of winning are still very good! We've had my kids and all their friends all playing and laughing and having a great time many times. Just a great game all around!
Helped my two bored kids from this stay at home restriction, now they play this game like there’s no tomorrow!
I bought this for my brother for Christmas, it came factory sealed, but when he opened it on Christmas it was EMPTY. The game card was not in the factory sealed box... It was a MAJOR let down..

Best Smash game to date with: tons of music, characters, and stages. The core gameplay is improved. It's an awesome party game. Story mode and single player content is a step down from Brawl but a step up from Smash 4. Online is not that great though.

So much fun!  My kiddos have played this with their friend, so when they got their own switch I had to buy it. They love all the characters.  I now have to set time limits because they will play all day.

For those unfamiliar with Smash Bros: This is a fantastic game for people of all ages. You can take control of characters from many of Nintendo's iconic game franchises, such as Super Mario Bros., The Legend of Zelda, Star Fox, Metroid, Donkey Kong Country, Animal Crossing, and more, with some guests from Sega, Capcom, Square Enix, Konami, and even Namco's Pac-Man. This game is designed so you mostly play against each other, but there's nothing wrong with pairing up and facing computer opponents or real people over the internet in team battles. You already have enough controllers for two because of the two Joycons that come with the Nintendo Switch, but for a more comfortable option, there's a full pair of Joycons, the Switch Pro Controller, and the Nintendo Gamecube Controller, but you need the Gamecube Controller Adapter to use those. A Must Have for the system, whether for children or adults.For Non-Casuals: Fantastic. This game feels incredible. There's a certain swiftness and power in this game that I didn't feel in Smash 4. First of all. Look at the UI. It is streamlined and kind of gives off that competitive feel. Characters KO faster and most, if not all characters that I know of , have kill-confirms, so you have a certified option to defeat your opponent. Online is on the weak side. For me, an ethernet adapter made a difference, but if your opponent has a bad connection, you will. Hopefully, Nintendo will improve the game's netcode. Just get it. It's GREAT.

You will start with one fighter, and your goal is to bring balance to light and dark.  Along the way you will gain spirits which will give you perks in battle.  Having the right spirit in a battle can make a big difference.  There can be up to 3 different endings in the game.  There is an optional tutorial if you want to take it.  This is a rather basic fighting game and is very easy to pick up.  I am not a fan of fighting games, and found this game alot of fun.

Amazing game, easily the best of the series thus far. Lots of characters to choose from, with lots of stages to battle on. While it might take a while to unlock all the characters, it was still fun to see who would show up next. The new story mode, while fun, was a little too difficult for me at times, and I went about unlocking characters the old fashioned way. As for controls, the usual Smash rules from Melee onwards are still the norm and as a result the GameCube controller is the best way to play competitively.

Was expecting something funner TBH.  Daughter loves it, but I find the controls to be awkward and the whole experience somewhat frantic.  I probably need more practice, but it doesn't help that there was no tutorial for a first timer into the series.  Just learn as you button mash...I did get a laugh out of me and my daughter fighting against a bunch of cpu players though :)  nobody knew what the heck was going on most of the time, but it was funny at least.

I never played Smash Bros that much before and I decided to pre order this game. However, even if it's very hard there are guides on YouTube and customization with controls for your liking to make it easier to play. I am still struggling to fight against the CPU players. However, for me personally it's a great experience so far. If you look at the game as a whole it was what I actually expected for the price and content. However, if it gets too frustrating to play I might update this review but overall I love playing Smash Ultimate.

The game is amazing, from the maps to the vast amount of fighters there is no shortage of content. The graphics are great and the world of light mode is a lot of fun. The game also is given a constant stream of support and events. There are so many small things to appreciate, such as the ability to change the menu music to the N64 version. The multiplayer does need some work in my opinion, but it is still great.P.S. WHERE IS WALUIGI?!?!

Over the course of this weekend, I've put an embarrassing number of hours into this game and it really is Ultimate. It's fast and responsive, the new modes and customization options allow for playing just the way you want, the Adventure mode is a pleasant surprise--fun and interesting--and being able to play it on the go is just incredible. Minor elements are missing from previous games, but the really core important things are here and improved upon in every way.Note: I have heard a lot of negative feedback about the online experience; I personally don't play it so I'm unconcerned and also optimistic that issues will likely improve or be patched over time. Time will tell, but this is not a significant concern for me.

The Mario brothers have finally released a smash hit squequal to the hit Wii game brawl. I was excommunicated by the melee and smash 4 community years ago, so it will be nice being back in a thriving community. I lost a lot or friends fighting over the validity of the tripping mechanic. My "pal" Rico Elroy routinely would humiliate me in front of my long time ex-flame Jenifer Wu (gamertag: Frostedk1tten). Needless to say I will be looking forward to using the piranha plant (my main) to crush Ricos stupid guy. I hate Rice. I mean Rico. Sorry autocorrect... dont get me started.

Super Smash brings the whole family together  in a knockdown drag out fight & that's even before anyone gets a controller! But seriously this is a great game, had a 30 yr old, 20 yr old, 14 yr old, & a 7 yr old all playing at the same time (all were actively engaged & away from their cellphones). An absolute must if you have a Nintendo Switch!!!

The story mode and the various maps throughout the game are a sight to behold! So many cool fighters to choose from, and the boss battles are epic too! It is also fascinating how one of the DLC maps changes base color depending on the music chosen. Highly recommend this game to other Nintendo Switch players.

Such a fun game! Best mode is the Smash mode with multiple players in your party, but if you're playing alone the story mode and challenges will keep you entertained for hours on end. Sometimes there is nothing like the original, but the progression of the smash franchise is one of the best I've seen. 5 stars no doubt

The best Switch game to date, blows Mario and Zelda out of the water. Everything is tightened up in the latest entry all around. World of light has some fun aspects although it carries on far too long than it should. Roster is to the best it has ever been and probably will be, m especially with upcoming Dlc. One of those games that will forever be enjoyable.
My 9 year old son wanted this game for his birthday. He loves it, so does my 12 year old son.
Fun fighting game. You can play against the computer, friends and family, or online. Great fun

Of course the gameplay is addicting and the fighting system is geniously deep yet simple at the same time Etc etc, but my problem is the online is absolutely trash. Do not go in expecting it to work honestly. But other than that, this really is one for the history books.

Although I specialize in tech reviews, my daughter is the Switch expert. We’ve had Super Smash Bros in other Nintendo gaming formats, so this was at the top of the list for the new Switch. As expected: AWESOME!

The game is great and was delivered quickly. However, I purchased this particular listing because it came with a $10 reward for later use, and it still hasn’t been credited to my account. I can’t even look at the details of the credit, because they’re not showing on the listing anymore, which is frustrating to say the least.
Want to play against your friends in a fun and thrilling way that losses your concept of time? This is definitely the game for you!

Came as expected, however was a day late. Seems to happen every now and then, dissapointing but doesnt affect the quality of the game in any way, shape or form. I guess the driver could prioritize his route better, but i havent a clue.

There are so many characters in this game. And the variety of the inkling costumes alone are worth the money. But mostly, this is smash brothers, it doesn't matter if this game is good or bad, people will buy it. There's like a million characters in this game. How can you not like this game? Well it isn't as good as melee but way way way better than Smash 64 and all the other smash games.
Don’t buy this unless you want hours wasted playing a video game. Seriously I swear time doesn’t exist to anyone playing this game.

The gameplay is fantastic.  Fighting is fast and fluid.  Each fighter is fun to play, if only for their awesome animations.  The graphics are colorful and fun.  The amount of quality content is astounding right out of the box.  Every character has 8 costumes.  Each mode provides hours of entertainment.The only problem is the online multiplayer.  It is lag city if you play at peak times like weekend evenings.  This isn't minor lag; gameplay will simply stop for a few seconds regularly.  It's alright if you play on a weekday morning, but I should be able to play an online match without mega lag in this day and age.

This game is the reason I bought a Switch and it's worth it. Awesome game with every character and they all feel great. I was not a huge fan of anything after Melee but this game feels fantastic. Absolutely recommended.
Bright, colorful and full of excitement.  It's a good buy and i have to admit, I play it too.

Best, most playability of any switch game so far in my opinion. Controls are easy and smooth. Having to play to get all the characters (while sometimes frustrating when u don’t beat them and have to randomly wait to fight them again) makes u want to play it more to have them all. Lots of different modes to play.Some people are trashing this game...they must stink at it 🤣
My Grandson loves it,  was so excited on Christmas Eve. Didn’t even want to finish opening his gifts.

I bought a switch just to play this game and boy was it worth it. The game is amazing and packed with so much content. The music, the characters, the collectibles, the gameplay. I've never had so much fun playing with siblings! I've played for so many hours already and have hardly even scratched the surface. It's a GOTY kind of game and if you're into Nintendo franchises then this game won't disappoint. Btw it's a fighting game lol the best fighting game ever imo considering how many things you can do.

It was on sale and I saved $10. The game is fun, but gets frustrating when my 5yr old keeps winning and tells me how he can be a YouTuber now and I can’t. Be cautious purchasing this game, it can cause sore winners.
Game is amazing. Just like I remember it.Pros: game is awesome
What can you say about Smash Bros That hasn't been said already.Great game, Nice Roster of characters to play as.

if you ever play smash before, this game is another game to have. its great fun and haves over 70 characters to play. best of call 8 players can play on the same T.V. another good thing they added to this game is a real story line. holy that's really fun.  i would recommend this game to anyone who has a switch its a must have for that console

Best one to date, characters are better balanced this time around and the complete roster is present. Single player seems like a bit of wasted potential but it’s a fun diversion from the multiplayer. Couch co-op and vs. are of course still the best. Because nothing beats smashing your real brothers in a round of smash bros.

If you are looking for a solid game that will appeal to young and old, this is it. If you are looking for a game with replay value, this it. If you are looking for game for your Nintendo Switch, this is it. A great continuation of a great game series. I bought this first day it was out. Fantastic.

Purchased this for my son for Christmas.  It is literally the most played game in the house right now.  He and his friends love the game.  The mark of a good game is one that can be enjoyed over and over again by many different people.  Everyone enjoys playing this game.Recommended Product.

This is the best group game you could possibly buy. Anyone and everyone knows smash, and with this iteration it looks to be more balanced while expanding the roster and maintaining the easy to learn, difficult to master aspects of the game. Great game and I'm excited for the DLC characters in the future!

The best Super Smash Bros. I've ever played. Tons of characters, cool stages, and the Adventure Mode adds a fair amount of playing time to it. It's even more fun with other people. I'm not a competitive player by any means, but it's great having a beat 'em up game that you can dive into quickly once you pick up the controller. Definitely worth the money!

I love smash, but seriously. Watch the Game theorists Matt Pat. Or as i like to call him Fatty mcpattyface. To get a good insight of the emotional battle the creator is going through. Nintendo needs change & so does Japan. They ask so much of him, & Japan government is oppressive in its ideology of work ethic.

Love this game there are so many characters that it is hard to pick my favorite because this game has the most characters I have ever seen in a game before it is Nintendo's kid friendly version of Mortal Combat that is how I see it.
I have been waiting for this game to come out since they announced the release of the Nintendo Switch. I couldn’t be happier with this game and I cannot wait to play this with a full group of people!

I was a little bit worried in the days leading up to Smash Ultimate's release. Now that I've played the game and unlocked every character, I can say without hesitation that this is the definitive Super Smash Bros experience, and to have it on the Nintendo Switch is another bonus. The game is packed with so much content and detail that I really felt as though I got more than my money's worth. If you have a Switch, this is a must-own, and if you haven't, buy one to play this game because it is more than worth it!
Probably one of the best games Nintendo has released. This one is amazing compared to the previews generation games. If you've ever played in the past you have to get this one.

With excellent multiplayer as well as decent single-player gameplay, Smash Ultimate is a game that just about every Switch owner should own. It IS rather fast-paced, so if you're not into that sort of thing then you should probably give this a miss - but otherwise, go ahead and get it. And have fun!
Great game! My kids love it!!! They play it all the time
Me and a buddy have been going ham on this game. Won't make this reviw too long because I have more characters I need to unlock. See you all in a couple months I guess ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
latest smash title has huge number of playable characters and stages, looks great and plays great too. A must have multiplayer title for the switch.

Love this game! Been playing for 50+ hrs and I've barely scratched the surface of all the content available (also haven't gotten into the expansion packs/DLC either, but that's another large amount of content). This is definitely an "Ultimate" version of the Smash Bros game!
Super Smash Bros Ultimate Is So Much Fun and Addicted It Awesome. 👌😎👍🙂
Its Super Smash you already know what you are getting into. So far I find the game enjoyable and very balanced. Oh and the game still has updates so dont worry about joining late

As someone who loves party games and fighting games, this game is such a great combo! I always get the newest fighting games, Smash Bros. included, so this was a must-buy. This is by far the best addition to the series I have ever played, with over 70 characters to choose from. Whether you want to play an engrossing single player campaign mode or play 8 player matches with some friends over some drinks and food, this game will meet all of your needs. Recommending this to everyone who owns a Switch!!

This game does not disappoint.  The regular smash mode is fantastic and brings a lot of action. The story mode with the spirits has a lot going for it. It allows you to gain a sense of accomplishment when you beat it, but if you try to 100% the thing some of the area's might be counted as complete when they are not.  Nintendo brought back a lot of the Classic modes that were in previous games. I haven't really played anything else on my switch since this game came out. Some of the new items are great and there is a lot of customization to how you set up your smash games that are good for playing with your friends.

This game is absolutely awesome. It has an awesome learning curve that makes the game challenging. There are a couple of things here and there that can get frustrating, but overall it's an awesome game.

This game is amazing! I rate it 4 stars because unlocking characters was way way too hard at first and then unlocking them later just felt like I was rewarded them for trying. All around though, this is a really fun game to play, especially with friends and/or family. My wife and I had a lot of fun playing this for about a month. Now it just sits there collecting dust. To be fair, that’s just about any game though.

Throw in a pizza a couple of friends, maybe a few drinks and you got yourself a good time.This game is capable of teaching healthy competition, and teamwork.  Some of the modes has a good element of moving more then just your thumbs.  Which makes it nice for my moms shoulder recovery as well.

Every Switch needs this. Good for group gaming, parties, kids, etc. Honestly would be weird if you has a Switch and didn’t own this game.Compared to previous versions, this has many more characters, no story mode, and a much better online play. Online is cheap.

What more do you need to know. Its freaking Smash. All the original characters, almost all of the original stages(with the exception of PokeFloats) So much music to customize the stages with and did I mention over 70 characters?! 70. Holy crap.It's Super Smash Brothers, just buy it.

By the time Christmas morning brunch was finished, all of the men, and my grandson, disappeared...they were all downstairs  playing this game (which I don't understand, but then I'm not a pre-adolescent boy, or a dad or uncle!
Son loves this game and he has a bunch of Amiibo’s that he uses with it.

My 8 year old got this for Christmas and both him and my boyfriend are obsessed with it. They have competitions to see who is better.Both of my brothers really want to try this out also, but whenever they come over the Switch is dead because my son overplays this game.

It was a gift but my partner cannot get enough of it. Buy it only if you don’t mind how addictive and fun it is, specially if you play online. Actually, if you don’t like playing online forget about it, this is all about fighting the unknown.
The best Switch game to date. The best Smash Bothers game to date.The adventure mode is the weakest part. It’s enjoyable, but not very challenging.

While online hasn't been perfect for me, everything else has been so good and online is better now that I put the rules off. I've unlocked all characters and I love trying all of them out online and can't wait to keep unlocking them in world of light. Best game I've played in a long time.

This game is the modern version of Melee.  Wii u version was fun, but this one adds an extra layer of technical skill (ie. new perfect shield mechanic).  Characters feel faster and more aggressive.  Havent bothered to start up the story mode but personally dont care much about that.  I came here for no nonsense SMASH and that’s exactly what I got.

Our sons have put in HOURS of time into this game already.  The only issue (coming for a 33y/o) is that everything opens to easy...  some of the challenge is gone; however this appears to be common in newer games (Mario kart 8).  But there is still much enjoyment being had so it’s still worth it!

Multi-player online is unplayable because it uses p2p instead of dedicated servers. No plans to fix this, everyone accepts this issue and still gives the game 5 stars. Don't advertise online multi-player if there isn't a playable online multi-player.
Incredible roster, growing more and more, many fighters, many moves, fron Nintendo and much more, very fun with friends, online is not so good.

There is so much content in this game it's impossible to get bored! It is a great game especially for multiple players! I wish I could find even more fun games that would allow 4 or more players like this!

You know how good smash is. You know you want to get it. If your a parent thinking about getting this for your kid, do it. Then get another one, for you. Then get one more, also for you, because your an adult and you get to decide what that means. I'm an adult and I decided that that ment I played smash. I do not regret this decision.

Nintendo impresses yet again with their latest Smash entry. The combat has never been more refined as it is here. Melee veterans will feel right at home as it offers fast paced gameplay, and newcomers will be able to learn quickly. The amount of content in the game is astounding, and a massive open world map for its story will give players something to do for quite a while. The massive roster is welcomed, and the player will constantly feel rewarded by consistently unlocking new characters. An excellent addition to the Smash franchise, Super Smash Bros: Ultimate serves as the perfect swan song of this long running fighting series.

Never played smash on the Gamecube or any other platform but everyone was clamoring about it so I just had to try it out. I can easily say that it's much more fun to play this game with other people. The controls and moves take a little getting used to but once you get a hang of it, you'll really start to enjoy it especially when you take turns destroying your friends. No doubt, this release does not disappoint, just prepare yourself because it does have a slight learning curve if you've never played smash before.
There's not really much to say about this. My son likes the game. It's easy to pick up and play for few minutes.

This game showed up two days before the Nintendo Switch console.  I was worried when I ordered it that the console would show up and my son wouldn't have any games to play.  It worked out great.  I got a good price and didn't have to leave the house.

This game is a must have if you own a Nintendo switch.  I have spent countless hours with this game and still haven't unlocked all the content.  Every time I get a new unlock-able character I spend even more hours trying to master it!  This game is refreshing in a time of paid DLC and micro transactions! thank you Nintendo!

Outside of battling my friends when they come over this game did not have a lot of replay ability.I beat the game in a week or two then went on to other games. Great game but probably not worth $60 or more. Would have been an excellent pickup for $25-30

Fun maps,  awesome roster of characters and skills.  My 12 yr old LOVES it! Lots of great nostalgia hits for the older crowd too.There's a ridiculous amount of content! The local multi player is super fun and very refined.Only con I have come across yet is that the Spirits thing is kinda confusing....

This game is incredible in every way. It is well-balanced between characters. There is no way I can possibly describe just how well the developers did in creating this game. It is probably as near to perfect as a game could ever be.

This game is very fun and I have to admit I've been playing it nonstop since release day. My only complaint is that the online play is laggy. This is disappointing because it was a problem in Smash Bros For Wii U and it still hasn't been fixed. I expected a smoother experience considering that it is a paid service now.

I had high hopes when I made my pre-order, and they were all surpassed. The game has so much content I don't think I'll ever really finish it, and the game looks, plays, and sounds incredible. I highly recommend this game to any Nintendo fan, as it includes essentialy every character from your childhood in one form or another. Eve characters that aren't playable have key roles in the adventure mode, and fans of the Smash Bros. series will thoroughly enjoy all the mechanical changes made to this edition of the franchise. 10/10.Delivery was prompt and made the day of release.

If you love any smash game, you'll love Smash Brother's Ultimate. The pacing of this game makes it feel incredibly fun whether you're playing for competition or just casual fun with friends. This game is AMAZING. Join the community and play with us!

This was a very wonderful surprise for my daughter who has been wanting this game for a while. It lives up to the picture and wasn’t a scam. It was never used and in very good quality when we received it. I really appreciate this product and would recommend for a gift for your child.
It's smash Bros. If you liked smash Bros on the n64 when you were 12, you'll probably like this just as much even though you're 30. 4 stars because I'm 30 and still playing Smash Bros.

I'm really liking the attention to detail and just the amount of content Nintendo put into this game. Every time I think I've finished World of Light, another part opens up. After completion, I've put almost 45 hours into it. Outside of a strong single player, this game has the classic multiplayer that really makes it one of the franchise bests.

The game was very repetitive and restrictive, hardly any story unlike smash bros melee. Overall was disappointed, and the stages are largely the same. Zelda and Sheik are now 2 separate characters, which is a bummer. Most of the new characters have awkward fighting styles, so they go unused. Would not buy again.

My wife and I play this quite often and enjoy it. We do strain our friendships with friends on this due to fierce competition and backstabbing, but this is a great way to settle debates. The choice of characters and maps are huge, and we have yet to get bored of this game.
There is not one thing about this game that I am disappointed with. I can't think of even one complaint. My favorite Smash Bros was Melee and this was the best upgrade I could've ever dreamed of.

Great local multiplayer. Has so much content and fan service for the price. I love this series, and this is my second favorite thus far, after melee. Only downside would be the online multiplayer, but that can be overlooked in my opinion.
good game online kinda sucks some times but just sometimes

I ordered this before it came out and received it the day after it was released.  I gave it to my nine year old as an early Christmas present and he loves it!!  My boys age 9 and age 5 have been playing this game and not any other.  I believe the updated version has more characters and things to do! Would highly recommend.

The game itself is a great party game with an average single-player experience which is second only to Brawl's Subspace Emissary in personal opinion. The selection of characters is the best in the series and is only improving with time. If you have friends over often and need a party game, this is a must have.

This is an exceptional game, filled with incredible attention to detail and over 70 playable characters from which to choose! There is an extensive single-player story mode and a "Classic Mode" that can be single or co-op. Lots of things to collect, and lots of replay value.The online seems to have lag issues, but local play is very fun. If you have friends but only one Switch, the Joycons can be turned sideways to act as 2 separate controllers, which is a great quality-of-life feature.

This game was so worth the wait. The new Spirit board was a great addition and keeps me coming back even a month after launch. Unlocking all the characters was a blast.The details in the graphics are amazing! You can see the hair on some of the Pokémon. This is a must have for anyone with a Nintendo Switch.

I bought this because it's Smash Brothers, and Smash Brothers is the not-fighting game that everyone loves.  I'd say that for fans of Smash, this is probably the most consistent and enjoyable title in the series thus far.  It's definitely got a few attractive features for return veterans to Smash, but the new additions to the game and to the gameplay will appeal to new customers.

• It is such a great game for kids and adults. Its winter time and I wanted a game for me and my 6 year old son to play. We both have fun playing this game and the graphics are amazing. We have had the game for a month now and it’s still really fun for us to play.

My 27 year old son loves this game. I bought it for him for Christmas. He was so excited and couldn’t wait. He played it before Christmas. He wrapped it back up and put it under the christmas tree. He said that he would recommend it for hours of fun.
I haven't had much time to play this game but so far it's fun and enjoying it. I didn't give it 5 stars because I haven't had much time to play it.

EVERYONE IS HERE! The latest series of smash bros hits it out of the park by including every past character. This is probably the best smash game since melee, but it still doesn't stand up to it in my mind.
Tedious and boring trying to unlock all the characters. And Nintendo trying to push micro transactions is personally disgusting. Pay 60$ for a game that will resell for 5$ at GameStop.

This isn't the game for someone who enjoys classic fighting games like Mortal Kombat and Street Fighter.  I classify this as a button smasher and feel most reviews of this game are highly overrated, or were posted by gamers with limited experience.

I got this for my Nieces and Nephews for Christmas. (Ages 3 - 12 )They have called me 4 times since then telling me how cool it is. The game didn't seem like much to me but they absolutely love it. Sorry bro.... Score one for the cool uncle.

I bought my switch for a variety of reasons but the boyfriend really wanted this. He uses my switch more than I do. With all the characters to unlock and all the extras, Nintendo delivered on a full game that really needs no add-ons. So the DLC coming out is really a big plus since the game feels complete already and that is how DLC should be done.
We have been playing smash for years and it still holds up. Good entry-level fighting game with enough challenges for more advanced gamers. Just all around fun.

This game is awesome! I normally don't play Smash Bros. for several reasons, the main is not really being a complete adventure like the Legend of Zelda, but this one is definately one of the best ones.  I love how they brought back everything that they ever had in this one. I would have liked to turn off characters that I think are dumb but whatever, it is still a fun game
This game is great for a group,  adults and kids. The youngest in the group might get frustrated by getting beat by the better gamers,  but they love seeing the new characters get unlocked.
Online in this game is worse then a bad joke. Lag is insane, "preferred" rules don't work. Nintendo deserves no more money till they make an online game worthy on 2012.

I've enjoyed this game more than the 3DS Smash Bros, and almost as much as Brawl...but while it doesn't have an incredible story mode like Brawl, it does have an "Adventure mode" that pays homage to hundreds (?) of classic Nintendo, Sega, Capcom, and Konami characters that more than makes up for it.  There are SO many characters in this game, SO many stages...if you're a fan of Smash Bros, it's impossible to get bored with this game quickly.

This is the best smash game just because online isn’t as good of a system as the previous game doesn’t mean we can’t appreciate the new features this game has to offer such as world of light, spirts, with a roster of at least 80 characters confirmed

Was a fan of super smash since Nintendo 64 and still a fan now. The controls and mechanics have changed since then but that means I'm not as good as I was before. It's excellent nonetheless and especially with a storymode. That sucked up a lot of my time personally. 5/5
This game is a great addition to the Super Smash Bros franchise. All characters are able to be unlocked and the developers paid much attention to detail. Would recommend.

I LOVE this game! I put over 26 hours into it the first weekend to beat every stage in world of light, unlock all the characters and some extras.  So if i had to say a negative, the online only allows 1 person on each console. Was hoping for 2 on 2 with a friend.
Had such great reviews and I never could get the point of the game. Would not recommend. Kids Hated it
It's a fun game and you can't go wrong with this sequel. It has so much to offer and you will spend countless hours playing this game with your friends and online.
The character selection is amazing. The game looks and plays great. I'd say this is definitely the best Smash Bros since melee for Gamecube. Bravo Nintendo!

What can be said about this game? I played Smash on every console it came out on and this is probably the best one. It has a type of story mode that's neat. You can unlock characters as you fight in the game (for free!) Take not EA, this is how you do a game.

I was so excited to receive this on the day of the release. It was delivered at around 3 PM. This game is very fun to play solo or with family or friends. The point is to have fun, it's not fully a skill game, Fun for all ages.
This game is beautiful in every way. With so many characters and stages to choose from you will have hours upon hours of fun. I could not believe I found this game for this low of a price!

Game came on release day, super happy. 1 star off because online always feel heavily delayed. Someone described it as "boxing under water" and I couldn't agree more. Even when frames are smooth there is still a noticable delay lurking behind inputs.

Compré este juego en Estados Unidos y me lo trajeron a otro país, y cuando mi hijo abrió la caja que estaba sellada con plástico, la caja estaba vacía, no tenía el juego. Ya hice mi reclamo en Amazon, no me sirve que me envíen otra vez el juego, porque yo vivo en otro país donde el servicio de correo es pésimo. Grande fue mi sorpresa que recién leo los comentarios sobre este juego y muchas personas han recibido la caja vacía también. Ojalá me puedan hacer un rembolso.

Very yes, much awesome. It's the best smash bros. I wish it had map builder and a little more to do alone, like challenges, but it is the pinnacle of party game fun times. 9/10 Best smash bros to date
Good game, decent value and some nice inexpensive DLC. The package deal is pretty great considering you can listen to the music for the stages. I recommend it.

Lots of fun.  My 5 year old enjoys it.  Can be confusing trying to figure out where your player is but that's always been the case with Smash.  The more players, the more confusing but the more players, the more fun.
Simply great!

This game was much better than the crappy predecessor. I played this with my brother while were were still in school. We would spend hours on this after classes. However, after graduation, we hardly even touch the game as it gets really old after a while.
This game is a must have for the Switch! Hours worth of enjoyment for both single and multiplayer games!
It's all it's good game love the characters is that it has too much having to buy this and by that after I just spent 60 on the game.
This is THE game to get. Everyone is brought together for one purpose: to kick the other person's SMASH! Lots of characters, lots of maps, still great fun even after all the remakes.
This game is like nectar from the gods.

This was purchased for my 9 year old.  However, his two older brothers (16 & 24) enjoyed it also.  They enjoyed the fact scenes from a variety of older games were incorporated.  It’s rare but nice to find something they all enjoy together.
I bought this game for my son's birthday and he still plays the game today and he says he loves it so much.

Arrived right on time and my 8 year old is so happy with it! He says it’s his favorite Christmas present. My husband and I have enjoyed playing the game with him, there’s a lot to unlock so we’ll be entertained by this game for a long time!

My children thoroughly enjoy playing this game!  I was informed that everyone who has a switch owns this game and it was about time that I bought it for my children. They actually smiled at me!  Thanks Nintendo.

This game is the best smash game (R.I.P Waluigi and Bomberman) everyone is here and the gameplay is way more fun then the other smash games and the roaster is amazing one criticism I have is the story mode is crap it’s not that fun subspace was 1,000,000,000 times better
Best smash game so far with the largest selection of characters to date, everything is top notch: graphics, gameplay, content, characters and controls.

I had to buy this game the moment after I bought my switch. After starting off on Melee and all the great memories I had then it was only necessary to make new ones with Smash Ultimate. The packing was great and it came just days after I bought it. Thank you Amazon and Nintendo!

Smash Bros really pulled out all the stops on this game. This has always been my favorite franchise, and it still is. It's amazing because it appeals to every age. It's clean and simple enough for kids, yet it's nostalgic and engaging enough for adults. With a much-improved stage builder, immersive single-player and classically perfect 2-8 player local play, Smash Bros Ultimate is the essential game for any Switch owner.

I like this game so much, it has every character ever! I like the music in the game, I even listen to the music when when I take my Nintendo Switch with me.This game is perfect for playing multiplayer mode.

The kids were waiting to get this game and they love it. They have us parents playing too. I like howwe can change the characters’ clothes and hair colors. And the different arenas that are offered for the characters to play in.
Bought this game for the kiddos and they have been hooked. Hours of clean fun for our boys!
Bought this game for my 15-year old and 11-year old nephews back when it came out.  Even today in 2020 they are still playing it.  Thumbs up.
Best nintendo switch game ever

I love all the new editions to this Smash Bros. edition, adventure mode is too fun. You've got your classic smash, but adventure mode has all sorts of new extras that me and my husband are addicted to. Great game!
My son played this at friend's house and he wanted to own long time. He so loves this game.

The game has everything you could want. Online play is what you would expect from Nintendo - confusing, somewhat frustrating, but ultimately allows you to play with your friends. Perfect way to assert your dominance again and again... is what I would say IF ANDREW WOULD QUIT FREAKIN GRABBING EVERY ASSIST TROPHY AND POKEBALLS.

I got this for my Son and he unlocked all the fighters in 4 days. [AND HE'S NOT EVEN GREAT AT SMASH] My Son's Been playing since Melee And He Totally recommends this game for newcomers and old fans. also the online has received a BIG  upgrade! You can now create arenas which allow the player to host a mini server with a max number of players at 8.also this game added personal modes which is a really cool feature that has never been in a past smash game My son gives this game 9.5\10
Smash Smash SmashSmash SmashSmashSmash SmashSmash Smash Smash Smash Smash Smash Smash Smash SmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmash SmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmashSmash

Got this for my 13 year old son for Christmas and it is the only game he is now playing on his Switch. He loves it!  Seller was also wonderful.  The game arrived on time and in great shape.  Would recommend both the game and seller!
I got the game on the day of the release, and im happy to say that i am satisfied. This game is a SMASH. If you haven't played, you haven't lived ;)

I've played a few hours so far and I'm hooked.  The textures and rendering are a huge step up from the last game and the fact they brought back every character plus a few more is amazing.  Multiplayer is decent (but there are matches where people are clearly on McDonalds wifi).If you have a switch, this is a must have title!

I’ve been playing smash bros since the original on n64 and this by far is the best one yet. So glad to see Nintendo still making awesome games that I grew up playing. It’s just a shame I can’t easily get all my buddies back from their now mature lives to spend countless hours all night playing this masterpiece.

Haha I bought it for my boyfriend and he definitely loves it. He bought the newly launched switch two months ago and he loves to play Smash Bro. However I got dizzy watching him play it on TV. Only if I am not dizzy, I love to play!

I originally got this game for my husband for Christmas, but I cannot stop playing it myself! I was never into this kind of video game, but I have played it more than the games that I was actually gifted for Christmas.
El artículo era el que se describía y nuevo. Llego en buenas condiciones en su caja original sin abrir.

We purchased this on Amazon to get a free $10 rebate card on the site, and it is a great game! One of our favorites. For something we were already planning on purchasing, the $10 back was a nice plus. Thanks Amazon!

Best Smash ever. 74 characters, over 100 stages, over 900 songs, 60 fps, and a good single player with amazing multiplayer.Only con is playing against people using WiFi is still kinda laggy. Use the Ethernet adapters, everyone!!!
Great game
Package was sealed and once opened it was empty. I was In shock but if you look at the 1 star reviews there’s over 50 complains about the same .  Smh I got a refund at least  but wow

Ever single smash bros is the same thing over and over. Fight over 2k games get the new characters play online. But I can ever expect any more from Japanese developers. They usually copy paste without any additions to get money kind of like dynasty warriors. Smash bros ultimate basically puts all the games in one. So if you've never played any smash bros befor your in luck. The game is always fun with friends or online. If you lack friends and dislike or lack ability for online play then this game is not for you.
Buen juego

I haven't played a Smash game since Melee, and I really enjoy this game. I spent a ton of time in adventure mode and had a lot of fun.The online mode still needs some work in my opinion as it's been fairly laggy for me.

Arrived quickly. Packaging was fine. Game itself is phenomenal; I've been a Smash fan since N64 and this exceeds my expectations. Online mode is weird and laggy for me; otherwise, I am thoroughly enjoying all the local single and multiplayer options.

Game arrived and first bad sighn is that it didn't have the original plastic wrap from Nintendo when a game is new, and open the case and it's missing the maual that is supposed to be in the case. While the game works and in great condition like it is new I'm not supper happy about the missing content even if minor.
This game has been a long time coming and with the DLC that’s been added and the ones to come make this truly the Ultimate Super Smash Bro’s.
The graphs and board are amazing fun to play and watch. Purchase game for my sons, best purchase they are so busy playing u don't see or hear them. lmao...
This. Game. Is. A. Blast. I have never really played it before on my Wii, but decided to give it a try with my 12 year old son. I have been playing nonstop ever since. I am a mid-40s Mom. :)
Before I even got the game I knew I would like it. I nearly did not know what is was about and when I got it I loved it 5 stars.
An all time favorite been playing this game on other consoles and still amazing!
This was a Christmas gift for our son. He loved it. He has played this game for hours. It s a fun game and very challenging.
I am amused for all the great content included in this game. Away from the DLC you can have LOTS of gameplay hours and very good moments with friends. Excellent game, truly recommended.

Almost gave 3 stars due to WiFit Trainer not being among the original 8 characters...but the unlock happened within my first hour or two of playing. I've been crushing noobs with sweet yoga moves ever since. That satisfaction that comes from destroying children and their favorites video game characters with WiFit Trainer is endless.

My son and I LOVE playing this game. We loved the Gamecube version, so I am not surprised. They did an excellent job on this remake. I consider this a must have game for the Switch if you enjoy fast pace fighting games.

The game is terrific. A MUST BUY for all brawlers lovers, especially if you like Nintendo and related properties. Really and amazing experience and I say that after having more than 2,000 hours of play in Melee. Really amazing game. Props to Nintendo & Co.

I love this product it has so many characters to unlock it’s insane! You start off with 3-5 characters and you battle them. There’s also a huge story mode with an amazing story. And the story mode isn’t too hard nor too easy. And it leaves space to practice! Great game to play with friends even by yourself

Perfection at its best! Either on the big screen at home, on the go or even with friends anywhere, this game brings the fun and action to your day! Adventure mode is absolutely terrific, SSB Ultimate is the perfect game for any Nintendo Fan! Highly recommend

The game was absolutely superb my grandson loves the game. As far as delivery I will only get that one star the person said they handled it off they left it on my steps anyone could walk by and took the package
I bought this as a Christmas gift and the recipient loved it so I gave it 5 stars.  If the recipient loved it then so do I.
Great games. My niece and nephews like playing this together when they have sleep overs

I received mine a couple days late since it got lost in transit or something... but the game is great! Love that all the characters are there and how they incorporate other characters from other series.

This was my kids' group Christmas gift this year. It got so much gameplay over Christmas with visiting family. A hit with everyone. I recommend having Pro Controllers for the best experience with gameplay.
My favorite game to kill some time on the train ride to work. I have to say it's easy to play and loads of fun.It's the only reason I purchased a switch.

One of my favorite games on Switch and there’s a variety of characters to choose from. My only complaint is that there is no challenges from past games. Of course this is my first Smash Bros. Game and I don’t know what the challenges were in other games. But from what I’ve heard from they were pretty fun. I kind of wish they were there but the game is still amazing without. Overall Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is an awesome game with some tweaks that could be made. 5/5

Simply put the 5th game in a series of fighring games that almost anyone can get a hold of and immediately have a good time with. While some would call it a port it is far more than that and it shows. If you want a. Fun game to play with friends then buy this right now. You will not regret it.
The game is fun for a fighting game and the world of light is just a pain to do just unlock  the fighter you want but it's still a fun game

Lots of fun, loads of multiplayer options, great soundtrack, graphics are crisp, controls are tight.Only thing that was disappointing was the World of Light single player, it has practically zero story
Good game but when i unlock a lot of characters i lose them and i need to get them back my grandson is telling me to write this
christmas gift to our best little friends , and it may be their favorite right now

Bought this for my boyfriend as a Christmas present and let him have it on release day. He really loves it and I love that I can wrap his other presents 5 feet behind him while he is so glued to the game to realize it! Win win!
Nephew loves this game, smash Bros is a classic and I'm glad I can share/bond with him over videos! Being two decades older.

It was a really nice item, but does get tiring if played back to back and doing the same thing, well at least for me. The online player vs player was a bit laggy which caused many uncertain outcomes in matches but it was fun nonetheless with friends. I would still recommend it!!

For me, this is the best smash experience so far. All the characters, good fighter balance, classic mode revamp is great, unlocking characters is no chore, tons of stages, the new spirit-based SP mode is fun and LONG as heck... Everything feels great.
I honestly don't know much about this game, but I can tell you it made our Grandson very happy to receive it as a birthday present!
All of your favorite Nintendo characters battling it out. This is a fun game for all. You can play single player, two or groups.
The game is amazing. Came on time with a download code for a bonus character (this will not be present if you purchase after release I believe). A must have for switch owners.
I skipped out of the last smash cause they removed my boy snake. But now literally EVERYONE is back. Holy cow. Im in elite smash with Snake so if anyone wants to smash lemme know.
Kids love it and so do i, big fans of super smash since original and this one delivered. Must have
If your kid likes a fun video game and you want to buy one without all of the violence, then buy this. Even parents can play it- a great bonding experience with your kid. Have fun!
The whole family has been playing this everyday since Christmas. We even owned the Wii U version, and this game is different enough to totally hold a 10-, 12-, and 41-year-olds' attention.

Wow, this game is a helluva lot of fun to play. Except down special spamming bayonettas in Adventure mode but that's beside the point. This game is far more amazing than I could've ever predicted, and it's so much fun to play with friends. 100% recommend, just don't take the right path in Adventure mode your first time around....
Game play is terrible jumpy and the buttons are reversed compared to every existing game console
Great game! We have so much fun playing this at home with friends and family

Product is fine. Pre-ordered game September 1. Watched the tracking show the game was an hour away on release day and then it went to another state. Awesome. It took 5 days to get to me. Ridiculous. Don't pre-ordered just go ditgial.
The best Super Smash Bros since the original on the N64. The unlock process is very satisfying and easy to use the Gamecube controllers with the adapter. All in all, this is one amazing game!

This was one of the best games I've played in my entire LIFE. Everything about it is great! The only thing I would recommend changing is the pricing of the game, and the new Pirana Plant. But other than that, it was great! The graphics in the cut-scenes are even better than the graphics in the game! They are seriously amazing! Anyway, this game is actually my favorite!
Got this for a friends kids for Xmas, they didn’t return it, so I assume all is well.
this is the best smash bros I've played so far, so many characters!

It’s SSB! What’s not to like... great game with additions of new characters and game modes. The added feature to have repeated encounters with challengers is nice. Definitely a solid title for Nintendo users.
Another fantastic addition to the Smash Bros series.  Huge selection of characters brings great variety to game play.  The single player mode is also a nice addition.  Easy purchase.
I got this for my son. He loves it. I'm not really into it myself but it looks great! My son has a lot of fun with the game. Worth picking up if you like Smash or your kid likes smash.
The adventure mode is unbelievably hard, and the online play is absolutely terrible. Don't buy the game until they make online actually worth it.
We bought this for our son who is a huge Super Smash Bros. fan. If you like the series, then get it.  I notice the graphics seem better than previous Smash Bros. but I am not into cartoon like games.
Ordered this game for my 8y.o son and he loves it. He's already unlocked all the characters and has only had it 2 days!!
Bought for a 10 year old. He and his friends love playing this. They played a ton of it before Fortnite erased it from their minds.
I bought this for my eight year grandson. He loves it and can’t stop talking about what a fun game it is. Great buy!
Both of my boys, ages 5 and 10, love this game.  I strongly recommend it to anyone who has kids in this age range.  Incorporates all kinds of characters.
And the most ultimate one of all. Enjoyable Adventure mode, fantastic soundtrack, and acts as a nice little museum of gaming history. Responsive fighters to be more in line with how Melee worked.
Great game, great content.  I love the multiplayer mode, and am still playing the single player.  The art is amazing, the music great, and the new assists are fun to see.  Highly recommend.
If you are looking for the kids to play a game for longer than a week, then this is the one that will keep them entertained.
One of the best fighting games I’ve tried. The adventure mode is amazing, really worth the money
Great game, came in original package gave me about 60 give or take Nintendo coins but there was a delay for delivery but came 2 days later, all good
Its Super Smash Bros Ultimate, what can I say! Preordered it and got it on launch, December 8th, 2018! Just hitting it with a review until now! Great purchase from Amazon!

I just don't get it. I had never played a Smash game before but always heard amazing things. This game came out to rave reviews. It made several top ten lists and was highly rated in the 'Top Games Of 2018' for a gaming podcast I listen to. This seemed like a slam dunk purchase, so I pulled the trigger. I regret it.This game is an absolutely beautiful mess, but it *IS* a mess. There are a ton of playable characters, and they are all ridiculously unbalanced and locked at the beginning, meaning you have to pour in hours of your time to unlock them all ... so you can figure out which ones are unplayable. The single player campaign, prob the main reason I bought the game in the first place, is an exercise in frustration. Nothing makes any sense. Here, you're fighting this recognizable character, who is possessed (yes really) by this D-list character. Did you finally win? Awesome, you didn't unlock anything except some extra sprites on a few more confusing screens. Oh did you want to play as that character? Keep on button mashing. Even the menus are frustratingly convoluted. Want to play the single player? It's 3 menus deep, keep on clicking. No menu screen works the same way as the last screen you were just on (yes really). Just getting into a match is a challenge.

Surprisingly, you only have the veteran 8 fighters to start out with in this game, but after a lot of challenges to complete, you'll have over 70 fighters altogether, including all the fighters of all the earlier games! What a way to celebrate the original game's 20th anniversary next Spring! But it don't stop there, Ultimate contains lots of other amazing stuff, music, and challenges too numerous to mention! How can all that fit in just 1 tiny game card, even GREATLY bypassing the 3DS game?! If it's not already sold out by Christmas, in any year for now, and wanted to try it on a Switch system belonging to you or a friend or family member, by all means, dig in! The characters have been fine-tuned for more fair fights; too bad the Oscars never were claimed to be fair, even today, especially to numerous Looney Tunes shorts during their Golden Era! What's more, Kirby's got a LOT of copying to do, take it from me! Like the Wii U and 3DS games, Ultimate will soon have added characters via DLC, like a Piranha Plant still in his pipe! I'd love to try and kick my new brother-in-law's booty at this masterpiece, it's even accessible to Gamecube Controllers and adapters for the Wii U, which I'm best at! You never know who or what you'll face next, or unlock next, in Ultimate, the Super Smash Bros. game to end all Smash Bros. games!

If you love the way the Smash Bros games play, then you'll probably like this. In fact, I'd recommend hardcore fans of the series stop reading this review right now because I'd rather not make anyone as upset as me right now.I'm done with this crap! Controlling the characters was always a bit like trying to draw with a marker attached to a string, but it might actually be worse in this case. The developers of the Kirby games should just stop having any part in this series. It barely works for Kirby games and it doesn't work for this! I tried this because I like playing as certain characters, but it's time to face the fact that the gameplay just isn't for me... Maybe it never has been. Sorry this is coming off more like a blog rant than a review, but I had to let some steam off somehow. I deleted the install and I'm really glad I borrowed the game instead of buying it.

Repetitive lame story one of the worst Super Smash Brothers I've ever played. With how long it took to make this it should not have ended up this way. It looks like a three-year-old put it together. I'm glad I rented it rather than pre-ordering it, saved me 60 bucks. I would rather play super smash bros 64 or melee in switch graphics, had a better story in the 64 versionHopefully Luigi's Mansion is better
Unbelievable game!!!

I grew up playing the original Super Smash Bros. on the Nintendo 64. I loved being able to play as a variety of characters across some well-known (and perhaps less well-known) Nintendo franchises. With each iteration of the series, I’ve enjoyed seeing new characters representing new and classic games join the roster. However, even if I can understand cutting some characters as the series moved forward, it was still a disappointment when I couldn’t play as my favorites in subsequent entries in the franchise. This is why I was hyped up for the release of Super Smash Bros. Ultimate.For the first time, I was able to play as a staggeringly large number of characters. The fact that (almost) everything from previous games made it into this one made it feel like this was a celebration of the history of video games and not just a party brawler. And while I didn’t bother with the DLC for the 3DS version of the series, I jumped right in and got the first DLC fighter pack when it was released. This speaks to how Super Smash Bros. Ultimate appeals to me in that I want the fullest experience of the game that already had a pretty full experience.

As others mentioned having all the characters and levels came at a cost. I would almost consider this game to be a for a collector than a gamer. You can say all of the characters and levels are playable but if you like playing the game, it leaves you wanting to dust off the Wii version.The “adventure” mode in this is single player only and just a normal battle with set conditions to alter the fight. These are repetitive and a harder one is simply more annoying than more challenging. Spirits are fun and bring nostalgia, but most do similar things. So, you lose interest quick.

The last super smash I played was Melee on the GameCube, I had a wii but never used it after some wii bowling the first few months. Fast forward to getting the switch and this is has been my most anticipated game. It delivered on all fronts. I couldn’t believe the amount of stages available in the base game. All the best N64 and GameCube stages included. It plays flawlessly, albeit still getting used to playing with a pro controller. Even after we’ll over a decade, I still feel like I’d be so much better using a GameCube controller, it’s funny. I will likely get the adapter just for this game. The box art is really cool too if you bought physical. Nintendo outdid themselves, I’ll be playing this game for years.
It's a good game if you want a port of Smash Bros for Wii U with no online, other than that, stay away.

No Co-Op campaign.  The only way you can play with friends is if you play the standard matches.  Unless you play Nintendo games by yourself, you'll probably get bored quickly with this game.  Very similar to MarioKart as far as replayability goes.

My eyes hurt.. My head hurts.. My fingers hurt.. I been drinking caffeine all day and play till my joycons died then grabbed another pair... It's been far to long since I've played perfection. Sure little things like menu navigation and messing with the spirits could be tweaked and improving load time per match as well even by a few seconds would make this 10/10 game Thay much better. I'm a collector.. I want everything unlocked I want to beat everything.. Everytime I think I'm getting close I find 10 more things to do.... Is there such a thing as to much content? Mario party is a 8/10 do to lack of content but I've had a blast playing it with several groups of friends... Smash I can be a hermit for all I care with 80+ hours of game play to keep me busy hell maybe more and will log more! I've been hyping myself up for months keeping myself from spoiling it and only watching what Nintendo wants us to and I must say... That game is 10x better then I thought... I don't regret it in fact I'm more then happy to drop the 25 on dlc because how much I'm enjoying it so far! Sure it's not for everyone but man is this game for me!Update: after some time of playing this game and exspoling what it has to offer I still love it and just beat the spirt world with 30 hours in just that with 100% completion. I am oh so pleased and I love how the light fighters can deal Alot of damage very quick but they don't have the power to knock people out of the ring early. The heavy hitters have the power to deal Alot of damage and knock players out early but suffer from being slower and soaks up damage.. So depending on who you play as and how you play determines how well you do against an opponent.
After 1 hour of play, it is already boring. Waste of money

Opposite of what Mario Kart deluxe did for me. In MK deluxe, pretty much everything is unlocked. I had no motivation to play it. I like playing things to see new content and feel rewarded in a meaningful way. Titles do nothing for me; earning a 1st place trophy in itself means nothing to me. This is why it was such a relief when I first started Smash Ultimate to find only 2 characters available. Yes! This means I will need to earn the other characters and not be spoon fed (where's the fun in THAT?).Speaking of unlocking, you can do that in adventure mode. As a newbie, I was really surprised how difficult it is! In order to progress, you need to defeat enemies, and each one is marked with stars indicating their difficulty level. IMO, there's a drastic difference between 1-star enemies (novice) and 2-stars (advance), which can feel like beating a difficult boss in other games. Thankfully, the campaign is structured in a way that makes higher difficulty enemies optional. It feels addictively challenging rather than frustrating.

As the headline states, the gameplay is amazing. The classic mode routes are great, the amount of options are finally here to meet our dreams from melee alongsidr a massive roster- but that's it.The menus are garbage, tiered and layered with a clunky unfriendly user interface made for only playing a handful of ways. Maps before chars is more annoying then I forst thought it would be (minor complaint), and the classic mode handicap coupled with rng deaths makes me want to return my game sometimes (I dont like developers holding my hand at the first hint of a challenge- nintendo is the worst about this)
The long and short of this is that it is amazing. As expected, fantastic multi-player, excellent visuals, and a wonderful list of characters (Isabel!). The DLC is promising as well. Best Smash yet!

*Might contain tiny minor spoilers*A new Super Smash Bros. game is an event that only happens once each console generation, and it never fails to be hype. Smash Bros. Ultimate aimed to deliver the ultimate Super Smash Bros. experience in terms of content and it definitely achieves that. For those not very familiar with Smash Bros. games, these are Nintendo’s flagship fighting game series in which characters from different Nintendo properties, and also third party guests, battle each other in an all-out brawl. The mechanics are different from most fighting games though, you are to launch opponents off the screen by building up their damage meter and then hit them hard so they go flying, while avoiding getting launched yourself. Up to 4 players could traditionally play at once in a Smash game but now even up to 8 players can do so at once. (It’s super messy and overwhelming to have so many people at once but the option is there if you want it).

UPDATE: Less than a week after release, Nintendo and Bamco released a patch adjusting the matchmaker, so now Preferred Rules actually work as expected. In my several hours of play so far, looking for 1v1 No Items, I haven't been placed in a single FFA or 2v2 or Items On, and almost every match matched exactly my preferred settings.So now the biggest flaw of this game is just about nonexistent.

Super Smash Brothers Ultimate really is the ultimate game of the series. Right away you have over 24 hrs of game music (before unlocking a little more), 103 stages & 76 fighters plus 6 DLC later (1 free if you register by 01-31-2019).Skill: You're given experience for playing, even if you don't win. (So losing will level you up.) I'm very limited (novice, horrible vision, no precision) & yet I can manage to enjoy it with easy mode & equipping the right spirits. The Spirits mode is an amazing tactical strategy exploration adventure that builds up your skills as you go. You release spirits of other videogame characters & can equip them to add their ability to your stats to lower or neutralize negative effects of the current battle as well as to overpower your opponent. If you wanted then you can give yourself status effects to make a given battle harder.

Have you played Nintendo games in the past 30 years? What if you could take your favorite characters from over 29 game universes and have them duke it out in a brawl for supremacy?Super Smash Bros Ultimate for the Nintendo Switch brings over 74 (eventually 80) characters together in a great battle experience. In this game the main premise is that you play your character, trying to take down your opponents in a 2D-style fighting game.

Technically this should be the Best Smash game ever, because it has ever smash characters available for play.  But I'm not too crazy about it. I wasn't even crazy about smash 4 for the wii u. Although I LOVED smash 4 for the 3ds. I think Melee had what most of the newer smash bros games have. It's a simple structure that all balances out perfectly. Melee had the arcade mode, challenges, great ways to unlock your characters, trophies. Smash Ultimate story mode was kind of lackluster to be honest, the world hub is basically just a drawn map you could travel from place to place but you have to fight the spirits to get through. It was a neat concept, but really spirits? why replace the trophies, they were amazing. I don't even care if you called them spirit trophies. I used to LOVE rotating the trophies in melee and looking at them for a while. All I can say is that Smash Ultimate is a heavily party fighting game. It has modes that can satisfy a lot of people. But the MEAT of all is the Spirit section of the game, and then you have online (online is always alright). All I'm saying is you can have ALL the characters in smash bros but when the main campaign is lackluster it really breaks the immersion. Whats going to happen is smash 6? are we going to get ALL the characters again plus more? Poor Sakurai, it's going to take him a bout 6-7 years to do another smash. I understand his vision with this spirit concepts, it makes us appreciate the facts that we need to have balance between light and darkness. If you have too much of one of the other. Your life will be controlled by it. I like that meaning, I LOVED the ending, but why don't i like the actual campaign. I felt it was repetitive.  I'd give this game a 7.5/10. I love this game, and I really wanted to like it more, but it just  feels like a better Smash 4 in my opinion.

This is another top notch Nintendo game!  Every single fighter from every Smash Bros. game is back!  Smooth animation, great graphics - if you think of it, only Mario Kart 8 and Smash Bros. on Wii U have had 1080p graphics for Mario...so this is a real treat!  A huge single player campaign that will take you 20-30 hours to complete.  The online I tried on launch day was smooth without any lag.  A must own for any video game fan!

Ok, people are giving low stars for the wrong reasons.1 star because you thought you were getting physical copy and instead got a digital copy. When you change your option to standard+ultimate fighter DLC the standard changes to nintendo switch digital code automatically because you can't buy the physical copy that has the DLC option.  The DLC is digital content.  You have to go back and choose standard which will them give you the nintendo switch option again which is the physical copy.
I havent played Smash since gamecube, so this game is brand new for me.Everything about this game is excellent imo, 10 outta 10, but the online battle is frustratingly laggy....
I bought this game and wow! It is fantastic. It truely is the ULTIMATE game.

This is probably the most "Nintendo-ey" game I have ever played.  It is dripping with playable easter-eggs.  Nintendo took a basket of easter-eggs, smashed them, and scrambled them into an omelette.  The classic maps with classic music is so freakin' cool with this oddly violent gameplay happening.  It has such a chaos-happy-crazy contrast that only Smash can generate. The roster is gigantic and I hope they keep it going with perhaps 1 or 2 more DLC packs after this one.  If I had my way, I would have TMNT in their SNES Turtles in Time game style.  I would have Double Dragon and Contra characters.  That would take this game into like 6 or 7 stars.  If you are into fighting games, you have to try this.

Although I have not played all aspects of SSBU, I will have to say that I have enjoyed very much what I have played so far.  Visually, this is the most stunning SSB yet, with great textures and images of each character and, specifically the stages (I enjoyed the updated older stages as well). The Spirit aspect is interesting and the way to get newer characters is more simplified than some of the earlier SSB (although similar to the last SSB for Wii U and 3DS).  Admittedly, I would have liked a simple trophy section as the other games, but this is a small nitpick.

The game is pretty fun but I've lost almost complete interest in it after 2 weeks. I was hoping to put in some hours playing online but the peer 2 peer connection is a joke. Sometimes you get lucky and there is zero lag, most of the time there is a noticeable lag and from time to time you get TONS of lag with 5 in game seconds taking as much as a minute in real world time. It's a real shame since i feel like online play is what will keep people coming back, if anyone one is curious my ping ranges between 14  - 26 ms depending on the time of day.

Online is Terrible. Matchmaking is a dumb hodgepodge random garbage. If you have a lousy match you are forced to stay and watch the remaining monkeys spank each other's bananas. Not to mention the mind numbing lag. If you leave then you get an online ban for a couple hours. Really, Nintendo?Rest of the game is entertaining, but feels stale quickly.

As someone who has never played a smash game, up until this game was teased... this game is complete garbage.Just kidding it's the best smash game I've ever played, yes, better then... the one we don't talk about... "melee" MELEEEEEEEE AAAAAAAHHHHHH. This review is the same one I've given on metacritic

The game is great, but I preordered the game because it said it'd be guaranteed by 11am the day it released. Well I stayed hom waiting for it and the UPS guy didn't drop it off till 4pm. I would've been better off pre ordering it at a store and going to picm it up. I gave amazon a shot for preordering, this will probably be the last time I do that.

Game is fun solo, but only a little bit. You play classic mode and it's really repetitive, world of light is hot trash and the online is just well, it's Nintendo so it's really laggy, and bad. I couldn't hit anyone in half the games i played, Literally going to attack someone the attack hits, but they take no percentage damage and immediately attack back, cancelling whatever animation you were doing prior to them hitting you, and you get outplayed by internet latency. The frame rate drop was unbearable when one player had a bad connection and you need to wait for them to catch up, which thinking about it makes more sense that they are probably lag switching to periodically stutter the game to win.Get it for a party couch game, don't get it for the online "experience" or whatever they wanna call it.
